description:
The Infected Pack contains all extra miniatures from the Zombicide Season 3 Kickstarter campaign from the Infected pledge level.

Survivors & Zombivors

Bastian
Cat

mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Spike! Journal #9
description:
Stephan Half-Elf is our (very appropriate) guest editor for a very special issue of the dedicated Blood Bowl background and rules magazine, Spike! Journal. He takes a look at something rather unusual – mixed teams that combine players from different races and cultures into something altogether new! Find out how they get along (or don't), how to build your roster and achieve victory on the gridiron.

This issue’s format may be different, focusing on three teams instead of one, but you'll still find everything you need to play as one of three new types of hybrid teams!

– Misfits and Malcontents: lore and rules for Chaos Renegade Teams comprised of renegades from nearly every race and background. You'll also find background on famous teams like the Chaos All-Stars and a full profile of the Mongrel Horde.

– Renegade Playbooks: offers some insight into playing incredibly diverse teams, and building them up over time to suit your play style.

– Star Player Spotlight: Ugroth Bulgrot, “The Other Ripper”. Not to be confused with Ripper Bulgrot, Ugroth eschewed hard work and training to cash in on the chainsaw craze.

– Dirt from the Dugout: Mindy Piewhistle returns to dish about why you don't see many Elves in mixed company, let alone mixed Blood Bowl teams.

– Underground, Overground, Sportsmanship Free: The term Underworld Denizens covers teams made up primarily of Goblins, Trolls, and Skaven. You’ll find a full breakdown of lore, rules, and a profile of the Underworld Creepers!

– The Quick and the Cowardly: An Underworld Denizens team includes quite an unusual mix of players, but they can be a blast to play. Read up on some tips to make the most of them.

– Star Player Spotlight: Glart Smashrip is a truly fat rat. Inspired to out-bulk a famous Minotaur player, Glart throws his weight around on the pitch with deadly results, earning a foul reputation alongside an impressive record.

– Chat with the Rat: Hackspit Quillchewer digs deep to uncover the ugly truth about mutations in Skaven society.

– Allies of Inconvenience: Teams of the Old World Alliance are formed from the natural admixture of civilised (relatively) Humans, Dwarfs, Halflings and Ogres in some of the great cities of the Old World. You'll find riveting background on famous teams, plus a dedicated profile of the Middenheim Maulers.

– Old World Style: At once tough, versatile, hard-hitting, and slippery, these teams seem to have it all. Our experts break down the options to help you build a winning combination.

– Star Player Spotlight: Helmut Wulf was one of the first players to pick up a chainsaw, and he remains one of the best.

– Mixed Fortunes: a smorgasbord of Star Players hailing from a variety of races and backgrounds, who are attracted to the motley nature of mixed teams by their very misfit nature.

Key Features
-All the rules you need to field mixed teams in Blood Bowl
-Includes Chaos Renegades, Underworld Denizens and Old World Alliance teams
-Tips and insights to wrap your head around these strange hybrids

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Alone Against Fear: The Village of the Living Dolls
description:
This is a 60-page PDF adventure for Alone Against Fear. Your uncle Phil is missing and you volunteer to help finding him, but this will plunge your character in a maelstrom of horror as you explore Harrowood, the Village of the Living Dolls.

This is a complete adventure that will require two hours or more to complete.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Never Mind the Billhooks
description:
Never mind the Billhooks is set at the Big Skirmish/Small battle level, the sort of thing that probably went on a lot of the time, particularly up around the Scottish borders, without ever troubling the chroniclers.
My original inspiration was Nibley Green, Gloucestershire, fought in 1470 between the private armies of Lords Lisle and Berkeley, with no more than 1,000 men a side.

Billhooks is a card-activated game with points-based random army generation and using only good old D6s.
You roll dice to hit and dice to save (depending on armour) so it’s very familiar Old School in that respect.
Longbows are deadly but not dominant since their arrow supply is limited, so to win a battle you have to get stuck into Melee.
Cavalry and skirmishers have their uses but it’s the heavy infantry – Men at Arms, Bills and Pikes – who will win the battle for you.

All the key rules are on a short Cribsheet (with no confusing tables of plusses and minuses) and you should find yourself playing along without too much reference to the main rules after only a few turns. A typical two-player game with about 100 figures a side will play out in 1 to 1 ½ hours but it will easily expand to a bigger, multi-player set-up once everyone is familiar with the common and easily-memorized mechanisms.

—description from the designer at WI
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Alternate Units
description:
Six new unit cards invader can choose at the start of the battle to diversify his strategy with their unique abilities.

Contains:

6 Invader unit cards
1 bag
40 blue wooden cubes
65 gray wooden cubes
25 black wooden cubes


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Spike! Journal #11
description:
Join our esteemed guest editor Jacques O’Lanterne as we dig in to what makes Necromantic Horror teams tick. You’ll thrill to hear how Necromancers put together their teams (literally, in the case of Flesh Golems), as well as the sordid history of some infamous Sylvanian teams.

The 36 pages of this dusty tome are stuffed with all manner of dark humour, rules to raise your team (from the grave), and advice to guide them to victory. As the first Spike! Journal to be published after the new edition of Blood Bowl, the content has been adjusted ever so slightly, but it will feel quite familiar to long-time sports fans. It includes:

- Things That Go Bump in the Night: covers where Necromantic Horror teams arise from, as well as an overview of each position – Zombie Linemen, Ghoul Runners, Wraiths, Werewolves, and Flesh Golems.

- Famous Necromantic Horror teams, including the Wolfenburg Crypt-stealers, Bruendar Grimjacks, and Pumpkin Patch Petrifiers, plus full profiles for the Star Players that can be hired.

- Star Player Spotlight: Frank ’n’ Stein – the Flesh Golem that combined the brains and brawn of two decent players to become something greater than the sum of his parts.

- Dirt From the Dugout: Mindy Piewhistle returns with the graveyard dirt on rumours of a Star Player's potential retirement – could he have a life after the gridiron?

- Star Player Spotlight: Wilhelm ‘the Wolfman’ Chaney – growing up as an outcast from Human society has made Wilhelm a somewhat eccentric personality, but his savagery in the field more than make up for it.

- Sylvanian Night-time Leagues: Custom rules for running a league season as the Spooky Skull Cup, as well as special rules to represent games played in Sylvania.

- Chat with the Rat: Hackspit sits down with the coach of the Bruendar Grimjacks about scouting and recruiting new players for Necromantic Horror teams.

- Trick or Treat: the pro playbook for new Necromantic Horror coaches, including advice on raising a solid roster, developing their skills, and running effective plays.

- Star Player Spotlight: Bryce ‘the Slice’ Cambuel – after a premature and self-inflicted end to his career as a living player, this chainsaw-wielding Blocker was revived to give it another go in the afterlife.

- Eerie Inducements: hire some of the unsavoury characters that abound in these dark and dismal lands.

- A new episode of Mighty Blow!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): The Bögenhafen Barons – Imperial Nobility Blood Bowl Team
description:
In addition to being an incredibly popular pastime, beloved by an impressively broad and diverse fanbase, Blood Bowl is also a shockingly lucrative business. Imperial Nobility teams have been springing up out of the woodwork of late, the seemingly bottomless coffers of their patrons hiring top talent, providing the finest equipment and training facilities, and supporting their teams through extensive advertising campaigns. The Bögenhafen Barons are the most popular of such teams, exploding onto the scene and shaking things up.

While superficially similar to Human teams, the Imperial Nobility have a different skill set that makes them very tricky to play against. A well-coached team can keep their opponents guessing while setting up the solid Noble Blitzers to score. They look absolutely incredible whether they're winning or losing, clad in the finest equipment you're likely to see on any pitch.

This multipart plastic kit contains all the components you need to build the Bögenhafen Barons, an Imperial Nobility team for use in games of Blood Bowl. It contains 12 players:
– 4 Imperial Retainer Linemen
– 4 Bodyguards
– 2 Noble Blitzers
– 2 Imperial Throwers

You'll also find 2 turn counters, 2 coins, 4 balls, 12 32mm Round Blood Bowl bases, and a transfer sheet.

The rules to use Imperial Nobility teams in your games of Blood Bowl can be found in Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Spike! Journal #12

This item is contained in Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Planting Evidence: Card Game
description:
Planting Evidence is a card game for 2-4 players that pits you against your criminal friends.

Each round, players must choose between planting incriminating evidence on their fellow criminals or using similar evidence to build up their alibis.

Build sets of cards to assemble fingerprints from partials, reconstruct DNA, build a car license plate profile, or submit weapons for review.

Be careful not to trigger the end of the game unless you have the least evidence against you, or you lose!

—description from the publisher

name: Zona: Sekret Czarnobyla – Dodatkowe żetony zagrożeń
description:
A set of 2 new mutants and 2 previously unknown anomalies that will add variety to your Zona expeditions, released in Polish only.

Rules
Szybkowij, mutant tile
"New Sacrifice – After a failed confrontation test, the Voice of Zona can move that mutant to any other area with a [Mutant symbol]."

Bies, mutant tile
"Killer Instinct – Any discarded result □ during the alertness test and confrontation test turn into ⊟."

Purchawka, anomaly tile
"Risky therapy – After defeating the puffball, you can discard an artifact to heal 1 injury."

Otchłań, anomaly tile
"Sucking up energy – After defeating the abyss, move the emission progress marker back to the "0" field on the emission track."
categories: Adventure, Horror, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Push Your Luck, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Five Parsecs from Home: Freelancer's Handbook
description:
Welcome, Freelancer!
As Unity extends its reach, diplomatic treaties allow for easy travel by members of minor alien polities. Across the galaxy, Krag and Skulker recruits join the already cosmopolitan galactic community. Krag and Skulker crews provide freelancer crew captains new options while undertaking salvage operations and other high-risk business.

Additionally, we are happy to report that, after persistent lobbying, Unity regulators are now allowing trained psionics to perform freelance work. Interested captains should fill out forms B343, B-F343, and A42 (supplemental) to begin the application process.

The Freelancer’s Handbook is the second expansion for the RPG-Lite adventure wargame Five Parsecs From Home 3rd edition and gives you 66 pages packed full of new options focusing on adding new characters to your crew, and on new types of adventures in Fringe space.

This digital release also includes several comprehensive rules systems that offer new and expanded ways to play. A No-Minis Combat Resolution system allows you to resolve a battle without the use of miniatures. We’ve also built on elements from the core rulebook such as more detailed mission generation and quest progression, as well as expanding the Connections rule to allow more elaborate stories to unfold.

This 66-page PDF-only expansion includes:

Character Options:

Meet two new crew species - the Skulkers and the Krag - and discover how to integrate psionics into your campaign.
New Kit - psionics, new Bot upgrades, new ship parts, and new training options.
Game Options:

No-Minis Combat Resolution - Play Five Parsecs without miniatures or a map.
Expanded Ways to Play - Expanded missions, expanded quest progression, and expanded connections.
Dramatic combat - New combat and weapon tweaks to make your firefights more exciting and action packed.
Scenarios & Settings:

Fringe World Strife - Add chaos and unpredictability to the worlds of the Fringe.
Loans: Who Do You Owe? - Expanded detail for your ship loans.
Salvage Jobs - A new type of mission that lets you explore a site full of unknown riches… and dangers.
This is the second expansion for the RPG-lite Five Parsecs From Home solo adventure wargame. Assemble a ragtag crew of galactic trailblazers and head out to explore the stars, pick up jobs, and every now and then — engage in some action-packed, sci-fi combat!

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: My Puzzle Adventure: Dragon
description:
My Puzzle Adventure is a collection of jigsaw puzzles that tell stories. Each puzzle plunges you into a different universe.

First, you make the jigsaw puzzle.
The, discover the story by turning over the jigsaw pieces one by one. Behind each piece, there is a little riddle to solve to find the next piece!

Damn! Your little dragon has disappeared.
Follow the tracks he left behind and help Lina, Sacha or Timon find him. In this investigation like no other, you can rely on your sense of observation.
Will you be able to find the Dragon?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pieces as Map, Storytelling

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Tantive IV Expansion Pack
description:
With its powerful broadside batteries and advanced command capabilities, the CR90 Corellian Corvette has served as the cornerstone of strike forces since the days of the old Republic. Now these vessels are among the Rebellion’s most valuable warships, slipping Imperial blockades and delivering the decisive blow in space engagements.

Within this expansion, you’ll find everything you need to add one CR90 Corellian Corvette ship to your Rebel Alliance or Galactic Republic squadron, including ship cards, tokens and maneuver dials. Finally, this expansion also includes the components you need to fly this or any other huge ship in battle, including a huge ship maneuver tool and a huge ship damage deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Let's PLAAY Tennis
description:
Let's PLAAY Tennis is a “pro tennis toolbox” that includes several components, allowing you to dial in to the level of detail you desire. If quick play is what you’re looking for, the Tournament Mode module will let you simulate the early and middle rounds of an entire tournament in about 20 minutes, reducing the field to a handful of finalists. You can then use the “For The Set” and “No Rally” modules to resolve the remaining tournament matches in 10 to 20 minutes more.

On the other hand, if you’re looking for detail, the “point-by-point” module will let you watch the action unfold as if you were courtside, with serves, returns, difficult shots, winners, momentum and even unusual and rare results.

The “For the Set” module is the main tool in the box. It serves as a bridge between the two extremes of speed and detail. It will instantly resolve the preliminary action of a set and take you to the potential set-deciding game--one player with the opportunity to win the sixth and deciding game of the set. From there, you can get to your final result with extended drama, point-by-point, or instantly via the “No Rally” results.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood of Venice – Creed Versus Crows
description:
The Competitive Versus Game Mode is played with 2 to 4 players.
Two teams are opposed in a Borgia Fortress in 8 stand alone Memories: two Assassins on one side and two Crows on the other. Teams start from opposed sides of the game board and must complete objectives before the other team. Both teams can call on their Mentor (Ezio Auditore or Cesare Borgia) to come help them.

Objectives are variable and range from destroying the other team’s Tower to capturing an Objective in the other side’s territory, to eliminating all the opponents’ team and more. The Assassins and Crows are intruders in the Fortress so Guards will act as usual against both teams.

This mode allows players to jump in and jump out of the game without any influence on the campaign. All Memories are independent and can be played in 30 to 90 minutes. All Memories are highly replayable depending on each player's strategy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Variable Player Powers

name: Maximum Apocalypse: Time Traveler
description:
"Time is a tricky thing. You always try and do your best, but there's this thing called the butterfly effect... Yadda Yadda Yadda, I'm stuck in 1998 working with you revolutionaries trying to fix the whole mess. Anyways, I'd appreciate some help once we get away from these soldiers trying to kill us." - The Traveler

The Time Traveler Expansion, designed by Todd Walsh (Set a Watch) and inspired by his love of Sci-Fi, features a quirky survivor who is great at avoiding combat. With 12 monster cards, 8 time anomalies, 2 standees, 2 map tiles, and a 30 card Time Traveler deck, this expansion introduces you to tons of time hopping hijinks. Whenever the Traveler is played, you introduce their Time Pod, which you can use to teleport around the map. Of course when you rip through space time there are bound to be consequences. You will have to watch out for time anomalies as well...

Maximum Apocalypse: Wasted Wilds is required to play!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver
publishers: Boom Boom Games, Rock Manor Games

name: Factions: Battlegrounds
description:
In Factions: Battlegrounds, you take on the role of a general who's leading an army of troops, spellcasters, beasts, and mythological monsters into battle. You and the opposing generals determine the battleground, gather resources, and score points by eliminating enemy units. Whoever first captures 25 points of units wins.

In more detail, to set up choose one of the six factions in the game; each faction has twelve unique units and five "home terrain" cards that work well with your units. Players then take turns building the battleground by placing one terrain card at a time into the 3x3 grid, each terrain card is divided into a 2x2 grid, so the entire grid of play is 6x6. Whoever places terrain first has an advantage since they have more home terrain than other players, while players who go later during set up determine the location of resource centers on the battleground or recruit their starting units last so that they can respond to the choices of opponents. Units cost 1-5 gold, and each player can spend up to 10 gold on starting units, keeping anything unspent.

During a round, all units have the chance to move, with the highest-ranked units moving first and with ties being broken in favor of whoever has the most captains, followed by whoever has the most units. Each unit has a movement, attack, and health value, along with an indication of whether it generates gold or mana and (possibly) a spell that it can cast. After moving a unit, you can attack with it, whether melee or ranged as indicated on the card. If you defeat an enemy unit, you can points equal to its cost in gold, so while expensive units tend to be the most powerful, they also provide an opponent with their biggest target for points.

Prior to activating a unit on your turn, you can pay gold to recruit new units, and those units will slip into rank order for the turn, possibly allowing you to put a high-ranking unit into play directly and giving an opponent someone on the battleground that they didn't expect.

Once all the units have moved, players collect resources for units that gain them automatically and for units located on resource centers. Rounds continue until someone has collected 25 points of captured units, at which point they win immediately.

Factions: Battlegrounds is centered on inclusion and diversity, incorporating mythology from all over the world and representing traditionally European-based fantasy elements with underrepresented cultural elements.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Real-time, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Physical Removal, Pieces as Map, Point to Point Movement, Real-Time, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: EOS: Island of Angels – Nation Expansion
description:
This expansion for EOS - Island of Angels features two new nations to choose from.

Gloyn

A group of mercenaries whose forte lies in tracking down and destroying Demon Lords. When their heroes are inexperienced, they appear weak, but as they boost morale and ranks slowly increase, more and more special abilities are unlocked, allowing the Gloyn to deal with any Demon Lord (and, of course, all the dangers along the way).

Lavaloan

The Lavaloan’s home island is always shrouded in a thick fog, so they use the sounds of their bells to find their way. Being so careful, they have more abilities that interact with the other nations: mostly their opponents get a trifle, and the Lavaloan get a trifle more. Moreover, they are not hindered by Demons on their ship – on the contrary, they have found a way to make them useful to them.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Nautical
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Worker Placement

name: Save Afghanistan, Comrade!
description:
A solitaire game of the Soviet war in Afghanistan. Soviet and Afghan regiments and police battle Mujahadeen formations, foreign fighter contingents, and local chiefs and warlords for Provincial control throughout the country.

It is December, 1979. Hafizullah Amin, a dedicated communist, leads Afghanistan ineffectually. In Moscow, the Politburo chafes under his failure to unify an increasingly unraveling ally. The aging Leonid Brezhnev has been slowly persuaded that, absent decisive Russian action, Afghanistan will fall from the Soviet orbit.

In what they see as a quick “regime change”, the Politburo directs Soviet forces to deploy throughout Afghanistan under the guise of assisting Amin. On December 27, 1979, Amin’s palace is stormed and he is shot dead (then grenaded for good measure) and replaced by pliant Soviet puppet Babrak Karmal. Success! Or is it...?

Welcome to the Great Game, Cold War version. “Save Afghanistan, Comrade!” pits you as the Soviets and communist Afghans against the Mujahadeen for dominance there. You have until Summer, 1992 (50 quarterly turns) to clear the Provinces of Mujahadeen to win. Or will you, like Brezhnev, find the Mujahadeen to be an indomitable enemy?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rome Alone
description:
You are one of the legendary emperors of the Roman Empire. And it’s time to show your mettle. Expand your empire through military conquest. Build infrastructure and glorious monuments. All while keeping the barbarian hordes at bay. Will you bring glory to the
Empire? Or will your reign be just another forgotten page in history?

Rome Alone is a fast-playing solo resource management game.
Draw cards and manage tough decisions about what to use them for each turn. Collect industry, culture and military resources. Spend those resources to conquer regions or build buildings to improve your engine. Or, work towards constructing monuments with powerful
abilities and scoring potential. Be sure to save enough military resources to defend from increasingly menacing barbarian invasions at the end of the round! At the end of round 3, compare your score to the
history books to gauge your success. Engage in the optional campaign mode to play a connected series of games and determine your ultimate fate. When the challenges start stacking up, will any stand by your side?
Do you have what it takes to manage Rome Alone?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Drawing, Multi-Use Cards, Resource to Move

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Camarilla Edition
description:
Camarilla Edition was the fourth Vampire: The Eternal Struggle set to be published by White Wolf, and was the first full standalone edition of the game since the original Jyhad/V:TES edition of the game was published by Wizards of the Coast. Camarilla Edition has since been reckoned as the "Second Edition" of the game, thanks to the release of Vampire: The Eternal Struggle Third Edition.

As the name implies, Camarilla Edition was the first V:TES expansion set to focus primarily on the clans and Kindred of the Camarilla. Most of the new cards introduced in this set are crypt cards (vampires), and are drawn from a variety of Vampire: The Masquerade sources, primarily Children of the Night and the various "by Night" city sourcebooks. The complete set of these 100 new crypt cards was later reprinted as the Blood Shadowed Court factory set.

The six clans spotlighted in this set are the Brujah, Malkavian, Nosferatu, Toreador, Tremere and Ventrue, and each of these six clans has its own preconstructed starter deck for this set. The set follows the metaplot of Vampire: The Masquerade, in which the Gangrel left the Camarilla and became independent; they appeared as a mostly-independent clan in the next expansion set, Anarchs.

name: Defection
description:
Description from the publisher:

Defection is a pick-up and deliver, ship customisation, space exploration and dice combat game set in a deep and developed sci-fi universe.
Unwilling to fight in yet another war, you defect from your factions army in favour of transporting your civilians to safer planets. However, as with nearly all things, in all worlds, conflict and competition follow you. You will soon realise the business of saving lives can be as cutthroat and deadly as the business of taking them.

Pick-Up and Deliver

Your civilians are caught in the crossfire of vengeful violence in which you no longer wish to partake.
Load civilians, aid packages and other cargo on your ship and set out for safer planets to re-settle and colonise with your faction.
Dominate other planets with your factions civilians and supply these planets to make them more valuable.

Ship Customisation

Whether you are in the game to save civilians or in the game to take contracts and destroy others, there is the perfect ship for you.
Hire crew, buy ships and upgrade them from the market. Will you stick with the base ship and pay to upgrade and hire new crew? or purchase bigger ships with unique abilities and upgrade those? Either strategy has its advantages. Whatever you decide, there are multiple ways to mod your dice pool and give yourself the best chances of success.

Space Exploration

Travelling through space is a risky business, flipping and resolving hex tiles as you move. Each tile refreshes after use, making space constantly changing with potential danger at every turn.

Dice Combat

Using the stats you have modded with crew, ships and upgrades, gather your dice and shoot. With upgrades and loot cards etc. allowing you to mitigate poor dice rolls and a flee system giving you the chance to avoid the worst, the combat system gives you a good balance of strategy and luck.

Gain Legend

Legend is gained from winning battles, dominating colonised planets and completing contracts/events. Will your faction come out on top before the war on Keleressa meets its inevitable end?
categories: Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang
description:
The musicians gather at crossroads and campfires across the forest. They produce their instruments, tune up and begin to play! They play tunes both weird and wonderful, with many a twang and bang from their array of amazing musical implements. As the tunes get faster and more complicated, the musicians wrestle to keep up and challenge each others’ musical ability.

The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and fun game of keeping up with an ever-changing piece of music, played by a variety of characters on a variety of characterful instruments from the world of The Forest Dragon.

The game centres around 3 double sided “riff cards” which provide a sequence of 3 symbols that changes in play. Players try to match these sequences from their hand of 2 cards.

There are also 24 cards that form a draw deck, containing 16 sequence cards which are matched and banked to score points. There are also 8 “special” cards which allow players to make special actions.

The game is customisable with several sets of special cards, which can be swapped into the deck to radically change the way the game plays. One set allows players to take cards from each other’s bank. Another allows extra turns to be taken, or to interrupt other player’s turns.

—description from the designer

name: Repubblica Ribelle
description:
"Repubblica Ribelle" ("Rebel Republic") is a partially collaborative wargame for 3-6 "rebel" commanders who must defend the free zone of the Republic of Montefiorino, in the heart of the Tuscan-Emilian Apennines, during the long months of guerrilla warfare that go from the summer of 1944 to spring of 1945, between Nazi-fascist attacks, difficult political balances and innumerable social difficulties.

At each round, a mission card is revealed, posing a problem related to the current situation that the players (representing various partisan factions) must solve by playing action cards (with military, political, and social values) and using pawns on a local territory map. If the problem is solved, the player who contributed the most gets the card, which will be worth one point in the final count, which will attribute the victory to the player who has been able to solve the greatest number of problems.

—user summary
categories: Civil War, Political, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Events, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Black Powder: Epic Battles – American Civil War Starter Set
description:
With the election of Abraham Lincoln in 1860, the tension between the Northern and Southern States boiled over into outright hostility. Birthed in the South, the Confederacy fought to maintain its independency whilst Northern troops headed south in a bid to preserve the union. Four years of hellish fighting ensued, consuming the nation. It was a war the likes of which the Americas had not seen before, and would never again.

It is one of the most studied military conflicts in history, with over 237 named battles in addition to innumerable minor actions and skirmishes. Tactically, battles were still largely linear - regiments frequently fired all their ammunition only to be relieved by a second wave of troops passing through the line. However, the technology of war had become all the more destructive, and casualty rates were atrocious, leading to some historians citing the warfare of the American Civil War to be a precursor to that of the 1st World War over 50 years later.

The Epic Battles system allows for gamers to refight these battles on a huge scale. The game is based on the familiar award-winning Black Powder rules system, with a few period-flavour tweaks to cement the battles in the ideologies of American Civil War doctrines.

This box set contains no less than 2400 men. Each of the two armies are presented on colour-coded plastic sprues; the push-fit pieces are extremely easy to assemble - enabling you to quickly get to the business of gaming this fascinating era of history on the epic scale it deserves. You’ll also find some MDF scenery to lend your battles extra authenticity.

—description from the publisher

name: Dancing Queen
description:
Dancing Queen is a 2-player, 9-card game about bringing friends to a dance party. You and your opponent both have in mind a particular dance to perform. Will you get your way? How many boys and girls should you bring? Will you bring a girl secretly dressed up as a boy to foil your opponent's plans?

Both players start with a secret goal, and need to manipulate the gender mix in play to fulfil their goals. There are opportunities to swap your secret goal and to change the gender of a dancer. When a round ends, you reveal your goals to compare who has done better. There are instant-win conditions on some cards. If you manage to achieve these feats, you win a round immediately.

This short and tricky card game features bluffing, setting traps, pushing your luck and reading your opponent.

—description from the designer

2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best Overall Game
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best 2-player Game
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best New Designer
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best Rule Book

name: Untamed: Feral Factions – Spirit Strike expansion
description:
The first expansion to the fast-paced shuffle-building card battle game Untamed Feral Factions,the Spirit Strike expansion adds the Snakes, Gorillas and Deer into the mix, adding new keywords and abilities, and enabling powerful new combos!

Moreover, the Squirrel and Platypus factions are also available to add even MORE variety to your Untamed Feral Factions game!

Content also available in Upgrade KIT: The Upgrade Kit includes the 3 new factions, plus all Spirit Strike Edition content: premium tokens, premium Quick Setup (vac)Tray, and all applicable Stretch Goals and Exclusives.

The original game is needed to to use the expansion or upgrade kit.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Galdor's Grip: 6-Card Knowmadic Expansion
description:
The third 6-card expansion for Galdor's Grip.

Using the clever deck construction feature in Galdor's Grip, players can (randomly) mix and match any number of non-essential cards from the Core Set with cards from an expansion to create new card and deck and interactions! This expansion offers new scoring objectives and ways to manipulate the order of the deck.

Galdor's Grip is a solo fantasy card game played completely in your hands. As you move through the deck, you’ll need to carefully manipulate the order and orientation of the cards to gain more knowledge of your surroundings and avoid hazards until Galdor is in position to neutralize Feragot. The base game is needed to play this expansion.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dinolore
description:
Wow! You just found a strange high-tech device that looks like a phone... but it's much more interesting. It has an incredible collection of DinoBits, digital dinosaurs that can be projected in 3D holograms! Gather your friends and family and discover which are the longest, heaviest, tallest or oldest dinosaurs.

DinoLore it's a kids game that adults will also enjoy. During the game, players will take turns challenging the rest of the players: «My Stegosaurus is the longest! ». The other players can accept the challenge if they think they have a longest dinosaur in their hand and try to win all the cards played.

Compare dinosaurs and build the biggest collection of DinoBits!
Wow! You just found a strange high-tech device that looks like a phone... but it's much more interesting. It has an incredible collection of DinoBits, digital dinosaurs that can be projected in 3D holograms! Gather your friends and family and discover which are the longest, heaviest, tallest or oldest dinosaurs.

DinoLore it's a kids game that adults will also enjoy. During the game, players will take turns challenging the rest of the players: «My Stegosaurus is the longest! ». The other players can accept the challenge if they think they have a longest dinosaur in their hand and try to win all the cards played.

Compare dinosaurs and build the biggest collection of DinoBits!
Wow! You just found a strange high-tech device that looks like a phone... but it's much more interesting. It has an incredible collection of DinoBits, digital dinosaurs that can be projected in 3D holograms! Gather your friends and family and discover which are the longest, heaviest, tallest or oldest dinosaurs.

DinoLore it's a kids game that adults will also enjoy. During the game, players will take turns challenging the rest of the players: «My Stegosaurus is the longest! ». The other players can accept the challenge if they think they have a longer dinosaur in their hand and try to win all the cards played.

Compare dinosaurs and build the biggest collection of DinoBits!

name: Secrets of the Third Reich: Doomsday
description:
From the publishers website...

"West Wind Productions and Grindhouse Games invite you to step into the world of the End Times with the first supplement to the insurgently successful Secrets of the Third Reich. In addition to containing new game rules, missions and background, this lavishly illustrated volume explores loads of exciting new character, support unit, and platoon options for all four major powers and delves deeply into irregular forces. Jump screaming from the skies with Crash Dixon and the US Jet Rangers. Assault a vampire’s lair with Paddy Mayne and the MI-13 Commandos. Marshal your horrific horde of Sturmzombies with the diabolical Gretel von X. Lead your stalwart Mecha Squadrons across the snowy plains with renowned Soviet mech ace Konstantin Samokhin. Raid the Axis supply lines as a desperate leader of the Free French Radwraiths. Do all this and oh, so much more."
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Kansas City Interurban
description:
Kansas City’s boom days of interurban railways started in the early 1900s and went away just as fast in the 1930s due to the rise of the automobile. This expansion map reflects the rapid growth of interurban railways and the competition to keep growing or go bust.

This Age of Steam expansion map features a Power Plant track in place of the Engine (Locomotive) track of the base game and requires players to make deliveries equal to or greater than their best delivery. All players start in hexes adjacent to Kansas City and expand outwards. The initial cost for the starting spaces and building a power plant make the beginning game very costly. Players must carefully consider pushing forward for longer deliveries because once they are done, there is no going back to shorter deliveries.

This expansion map was released for attendees of the inaugural Age of Steam Con in March 2018 and then made available for purchase at and after HeavyCon in May 2018.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 2
description:
A collection of 12 ASL scenarios designed for tournament play. Originally intended for the Florida ASL tournament, issues now premier at the ASLOK tournament.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader


Contents:
Designer notes and articles (20 pages)
12 scenarios SP13 - SP24

SP13 - Stopped Cold
Reuler, Luxemburg, 17 December 1944

SP14 - The Green House
Barrigada, Guam, The Marianas, 2 August 1944

SP15 - Tabacchificio, Fiocche
Persano, Italy, 11 September 1943

SP16 - Hilfe Kommt
Rittershoffen, Alsace, France, 17 January 1945

SP17 - Cross of Lorraine
Hatten, Alsace, France, 15 January 1945

SP18 - An Arm and a Leg
San Terenzo, Italy, 21 April 1945

SP19 - Men From Mars

categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Le Berwick 1795 / Le Swiftsure 1801
description: An additional French flagged, Elizabeth class ship-of-the-line for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'D' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Goblin Secret Weapons
description:
Description from the publisher:

Those dastardly goblins have concocted a range of deadly – and almost certainly illegal – secret weapons to use for Blood Bowl! We can see the classic ball and chain, an actual bomb, and a chainsaw will be making their way onto the pitch via Goblin sneakiness.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Tyreese Booster
description:
Starving and freezing, Tyreese – armed only with a hammer – led his family in search of sustenance, and stumbled upon Rick and his fellow survivors. Mercifully, Rick provided food for Tyreese’s trio, and took an instant liking to their leader, a former Atlanta Falcons linebacker.

This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Tyreese and the scavenger Carlos to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

Plastic Tyreese Miniature
Plastic Carlos Miniature
Plastic Walker Miniature
Tyreese and Carlos Character Cards
Arctic Warfare Sniper Rifle, Claw Hammer, Football Helmet, and Football Pads Equipment Cards
Mantic Point

name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – The Swordsman
description:
This mini-expansion to Dark Rituals contains one playable Hero miniature, the Swordsman, his Hero ID Card, Weapon card and Alchemy Card.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – The Unmade
description:
Hailing from the island of Tzlid, close to the Shyish Nadir, the Unmade are a tribe of cannibal killers obsessed with pain and bodily mutilation. To these sadistic creatures, true worship of Chaos can be achieved only through the giving and receiving of agony.

Strike terror into the hearts of your foes with The Unmade! This Warcry warband set allows you to field these horrifying cultists in your skirmish battles, containing:

9 multipart plastic The Unmade Miniatures: 1 Blissful One, 1 Joyous One, 3 Ascended Ones and 4 Awakened Ones
An Unmade Abilities card, allowing you to unleash the distinctive and deadly battle tactics of this warband in your games
5 Fighter Cards for keeping track of your rules at a glance, plus divider cards for tracking your tokens


What’s more, these warriors of Shyish are available for use in your Warhammer Age of Sigmar army thanks to a free downloadable warscroll.

This set is supplied with 4 x 25mm round bases, 3 x 28mm round bases, 1 x 32mm round base and a 1 x 40mm round base.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ironrise
description:
Purchase at www.ironrise.com

A 2-6 player adventure card game featuring co-operative play in a team vs. team format. The game is set in a narrative world existing in media beyond the game itself (Spirel), and is set up as groups of adventuring Heroes (one team) faces off against scheming Villains (the other team).

Mechanically, Ironrise uses cards as assets which must be managed and played in an adversarial manner against the other team. The core mechanic is the "challenge" in which cards are used from each team in "slots" in order to determine who is the victor in an array of encounters, in a quest to accrue the most victory points.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Tiamat Premium Figure
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Tiamat Premium Figure includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Gugadeth and the Beast Expansion
description:
This expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters includes:

1 Highly Detailed Plastic Miniature, Gugadeth and the Beast.
2 Vampire ID Cards.
10 Elder Influence Cards.
1 Rule Sheet.

Both Gugadeth and the Beast are Elder Vampires. They have their own Elder Influence Cards, and can be added to any Hunt that includes an Elder Vampire.

GUGADETH AND THE BEAST

Gareth was a kennel master living on a small country estate. When the Night swept through, he was feeding the hounds, making sure the pack leader, Dex, did not take too much more than his fair share. The Vampires sensed the vicious nature of the hunting dogs, so it was the pack that the Vampires turned, while the workers and family were simply drained as food. But the kennel master’s de¬votion to his pack gave him the strength to cling to this world, although the corruption in his dying body meant he was no longer truly capable of that emotion.
Caring for the pack of Guardians was now his new role in the clan and soon the pack ran at the vanguard of the Vampire raiding parties. With so much blood spilt, his power grew, as did the Guardian’s alpha, who was seemingly immune to the harm that caused attrition to the pack. What was devotion was now an unholy bond, passing power in both directions.

Slowly the pack began to spend more time hunting and sleeping alone. Despite their ag¬gression, Guardians fell in battle, and eventu¬ally it was just the pair that was left. No-one from the clan was there to chastise the kennel master for his slack work, but then, he was no mere minion anymore and would not take criticism easily.

No, Gareth and Dex had grown to be the Elders Gugadeth and the Beast, forever bound as a pack of two.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Void Swarms and Void Hives Enemy Pack
description:
This enemy pack includes all the necessary materials to add two new enemies to your Shadows of Brimstone game, the Void Swarms, and their Hives. The enemy pack includes minis for both enemies, Enemy Record sheets, and all the necessary threat cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Unfinished Business: Famiglia Cards
description:
This expansion is not a sale item, but is/was exclusively available for free to all Unfinished Business pre-orderers during the pre-order campaign.

Contents of the "Famiglia Cards" expansion:

12 playing cards (63x88mm) consisting of:

6 event cards (in German)

6 action cards (in German)

—description from the publisher (translated)

Diese Erweiterung ist kein Verkaufsartikel, sondern ist/war exklusiv und gratis erhältlich für alle Vorbesteller von Unfinished Business während der Vorbestellerkampagne.

Inhalt der "Famiglia Cards" Erweiterung:

12 Spielkarten ( 63x88mm) bestehend aus:

6 Ereigniskarten (deutsch)

6 Aktionskarten (deutsch)

—description from the publisher

name: Offensive Adult Party Game
description:
Parody card game in the style of Cards Against Humanity and its adaptations. 3-18 players each receive an identical white card to play against a single black topic card, inevitably resulting in the sentence "I like playing offensive adult party games because... I lack creativity and enjoy the illusion of being funny."

Compatible with Cards Against Humanity and theoretically suitable of being used as an expansion pack, whether ironically or not.

—user summary

name: Pacific Go
description:
User summary
Pacific Go is a game about the Pacific War. One player takes the role of the Japanese army, and the other is the Allied powers, and both struggle for their own forces' victory. The game is played in 10 rounds, playing time is about 90 - 120 minutes.

Both forces consume "Resource points (RP)", for both moving and attacking. The Japanese forces gain RP when they control certain resource production areas, whereas the Allies gain a fixed number of RP. The Japanese consume 1 RP per unit per area, whereas the Allies consume 1 RP per unit regardless of moved areas.

Some important areas have Victory Point values assigned. At the end of the game, the Allies win if they have gained enough VPs. Japan wins if they have successfully blocked the Allies from gaining VPs.

Publisher's summary
『PACIFIC GO』は、太平洋戦争を題材としたボードゲームです。一人は日本軍、もう一人は連合軍を担当して、自軍を勝利に導きます。
ゲームは全10ターンからなり、プレイタイムは90分から120分程度です。
両軍とも、移動と戦闘に「資源ポイント（RP）」を必要とします。日本軍は資源エリアを支配することで獲得し、連合軍は毎ターン規定数を獲得します。
日本軍は１ユニットが１エリア移動するたびに１RPを消費します。連合軍は何エリア移動しても１ユニットにつき１ポイントの消費です。
重要エリアにはVPが設定されていて、最終的に連合軍が規定数以上のVPを獲得していれば勝利。それを阻止すれば日本軍の勝利です。

name: Agricola: Rozšíření
description:
The Czech version of Agricola was published without Minor Improvement and Profession cards. This expansion adds them.

—user summary

This expansion brings to Agricola more other options to play. Improve your economy by new equipment and learn your family new job assignment. Game will be more fun.

E-Deck for basic play
I-Deck for interactive play
K-Deck for complex play

—description from the pulisher (translated)

name: Dogs of War: Count Iago
description:
A new playable dog of war that comes with its own busts and special ability.

Count Iago, special ability: informer (discard a tactic card to get 2 coins)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Piquet: Cartouche
description:
Cartouche is an eighteenth century supplement for the Piquet miniatures rules. It covers such conflicts as the Wars of Marlborough, Seven Years War, and the American Revolutionary War.

Expands:

Piquet: Master Rules for Wargaming
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Dangerous Parallel
description:
Dangerous Parallel is an instructional game that was created in 1969 by the Foreign Policy Association and published by Scott, Foresman & Co. In the game students are divided into small groups of 2 to 6 members, each playing a ministerial role in the government of six nations that correspond roughly to the real-life participants of the Korean War conflict.

The nations are:

Inland (N Korea)
Outland (S Korea)
Transania (Soviet Union)
Hameel (China)
New Zenith (the West)
and Nordo (India, the Third World?)

This game was originally released as a seven box set. Each nation receives its own box (as named above) of briefing materials. In addition, the Control box contains materials for the instructor to moderate the game.

In Dangerous Parallel, there are a number of different scenarios. The one that I played is essentially the same as the Korean War. Inland invades Outland who are aided by New Zenith. After a vicious and successful counterattack, the players are asked to make the next move. Will, for example, Hameel aid Inland, risking nuclear war if Transania becomes involved.

Each country has the following ministers:

Chief Minister
Defense Minister
Political Minister (Minister of Interior, or Police)
Foreign Minister
Foreign Intelligence Minister
Economics Minister
Minister of Information
Several Ambassadors

There is a requirement that the Foreign Minister is not the Chief Minister to allow for espionage. Also, you can allow for multiple roles for each participant.

name: Typhon
description:
It is the time of Jason and of Hercules, of Achilles and Hector, the time of Mythological Greece. A time of Heroes and Legend, of Monsters and the Gods of Olympus. You may wish to emulate Odysseus and travel the world or gather the Argonauts and quest for the Golden Fleece. If you favour war then lay siege to Troy or Thebes, if you wish fame then seek out and destroy the Hydra of Lerna or the fabled Cyclopes or Minotaur or any of the other creatures of Greece. It is the Will of the Gods!

Alternative Armies' Skirmish level, character based, wargame for use with 50mm Greek Mythological miniatures.

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – Stars and Stripes Forever
description:
An army book for Command Decision: Test of Battle. It covers the US Army in the West (Africa and Europe) from 1942 to 1945 during WWII.

Features the following:
-- Complete TO&Es for all division types as well as corps and army level formations in Command Decision terms.
-- Discussion of training and doctrine of the US Army in WWII.
-- Special rules for the US Army in Command Decision.
-- Updated Vehicle and Weapon charts for the US Army in Command Decision, including aircraft.

Expands:

Command Decision: Test of Battle
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: 101 giochi con carta e matita
description:
One of the most complete books about paper and pencil games in the world. It contains 101 games among traditional, less known and totally original ones, all to be played with just paper and pencils. Featuring contributions by renown game designers as Spartaco Albertarelli, Domenico Di Giorgio, Alessandro Gatti, Dan Glimne, Beppi Menozzi, Paolo Mori, Water Obert, Pier Giorgio Paglia, Silvano Sorrentino and Andrés Voicu. Rules, variants, history, anecdotes, problems and strategy/tactics notes are included.

In the '90s, a previous Super Sharp Pencil & Paper Games featuring 50 games (39 in the English and Korean editions) appeared.

In 2008 a reduced version for children, with rewriteable boards, has been published by Editoriale Scienza as "Battaglia navale e altri giochi con carta e matita".

In 2016 another reduced edition with 48 games, aimed to families, appeared as "Giochiamo insieme con carta e matita", by Edizioni Sonda.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Bluffing, Book, Deduction, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Fighting, Math, Maze, Memory, Number, Party Game, Political, Science Fiction, Sports, Territory Building, Travel, Video Game Theme, Wargame, Word Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Enclosure, Line Drawing, Memory, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Alam Halfa
description:
Alam Halfa is an operational level simulation of the World War 2 battle between Axis and Allied forces around El Alamein in Egypt, conducted during the period of the 31st August to the 5th September 1942. Axis Field Marshall Erwin Rommel launched his attack against the Allied forces comprising the British 8th Army, in what was to become the last major offensive conducted by Axis forces in Egypt.

Alam Halfa comprises:

-One Rule book
-One Mapsheet (two halfs that overlap)
-One and a half counter sheets in full color (312 counters)
-Two cardstock support point charts
-Four unit strength roster sheets
-Two play aid cards in color
-Three Zip lock counter bags.

name: Arcanum: Call to Adventure
description:
From the publisher:

Arcanum, Call to Adventure is the newest expansion for the Arcanum game system. Take the old map tiles and throw them away, we have new, better tiles for you now. A hex shaped tile replaces the old tile system and allows easier movement through trails and better overall graphics. Now the creation of the Arcanum world falls into your hands, as you and other players try out new configurations and pathways to adventure.

Expands:

Arcanum

name: Down in Flames: The Netherlands East Indies
description:
The Netherlands East Indies is an extension part/ module to the "Down In Flames"-Series - Volume 2: Zero! game by GMT Games. This DiF Module was published in RBM's C3i Magazine Nr14.

The invasion of the Netherlands East Indies began on 11 January 1942 when Japanese troops based in the Philippines landed on Borneo and the Celebes. Two weeks later, other Japanese troops, using Malaya as a staging area, invaded Sumatra.

"Down in Flames" series is a card-driven game that simulate WW2 air combat.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Gem Thieves
description:
One night only!. That's all the time the invaluable MacGuffin Gems will be on display on the Metropolis Museum. As one of the top four thieves in the city, you've prepared for months to infiltrate the museum and steal the Gems. Now that you're inside the museum, you not only need to sneak from the guards, but also dodge the other thieves' attempts to spoil your plans.

Sneak your way to the Gems while trying to catch your opponents in this simple stealth tile game.

Thanks to Massimiliano Cuccia, now the Italian translation of the rules are available.

Want a copy? send an email to memegamestudios@gmail.com (only copies in Spanish available).
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory, Print & Play
mechanics: Memory, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: SFIRS
description:
SFIRS, phonetic writing for the word 'spheres'. Why? Because there aren't any spheres in the game, just cubes, so the name helps compensate...

SFIRS applies truly unique mechanisms for placing and capturing pieces (cubes).

Be the last player to be able to make a move and win the game. But when do you sacrifice your cubes for better area control? And when is it wise to chain moves in order to get ahead?

name: World in Flames Master Edition
description:
(from ADG's website:)

Australian Design Group is pleased to announce our latest project, World in Flames - The Master Edition, the definitive boardgame of World War II.

Since 1999 Rüdiger Rinscheidt has been working on the Master Edition’s design and development. It is a complete conflict simulation about the Second World War for 2-5 players on divisional scale. This boardgame does not replace World in Flames - The Final Edition but supplements it in fine detail for the afficionado of World War II history.

While based on Australian Design Group's award winning game World in Flames, the Master edition has many new features including:
• monthly turns;
• divisional scale;
• reserve movement;
• crack units for every major power (like Guard Banner Armies);
• complete new land combat system including battle points (like surprise points within naval battles), simultaneous attack/defence dice rolls and reserve movement after combat (both attacker and defender);
• and much much more (see fuller description below).

WiF Master edition is a complete boxed game that comes in two versions, the standard game played using the 5 World in Flames maps (i.e. can be played within the same space as the current game) and the deluxe version which includes 6 large maps (and the US minimap) providing far greater scope for sweeping operational manoeuvres across the globe.

The rules are the same length as the current rule set and you can download the draft version at www.gdg.de.

Contents
• 6 large (1168mm x 820mm) maps
• 4800 full colour counters
• 1 Rules book
• 1 Scenarios book
• Combat Charts
• 2 x 10-sided dice
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Australian Design Group

name: Naval Thunder: Bitter Rivals
description:
Naval Thunder: Bitter Rivals is a huge expansion of the Battleship Row WW2 naval combat core rules with over 130 new classes of ship representing the fleets of Britain, Germany, France, and Italy as well as data cards for merchants and transports for use in convoy games. Special nationality-specific rules represent the unique character of each fleet.

Also included are 13 carefully researched historical scenarios featuring many of the most important naval battles of the war from the Atlantic, Pacific, and Mediterranean theaters. Scenarios range in size from small cruiser actions to huge fleet engagements. Each scenario includes a complete order of battle, deployment map, victory conditions, overview, and historical outcome.

A half dozen new special scenario rules, including minefields, shore batteries, mechanical breakdowns, and more, allow you to confront the same challenges faced by the historical commanders.

The flash preview below will let you page through the rules & scenario portions of the book to see the exciting content it includes. Ship data cards are included with the purchase but do not appear in the preview.

Requires Battleship Row core rules to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: BattleTech Field Manual: Lyran Alliance
description:
From the back of the book:

House Steiner has always been the unchallenged economic power of the Inner Sphere. Transformed from merchant-princes to a military juggernaut by years of war, the alliance with House Davion gave them the most powerful 'Mechs money can buy and a streamlined chain of command. Now, the Steiner-Davion alliance has fractured from within, threatening to engulf both nations in civil war.

BattleTech Field Manual: Lyran Alliance reveals the strengths and weaknesses of the new Alliance forces. This manual describes each Lyran regiment and its loyalties, profiles and special rules, plus cutting-edge equipment and the latest 'Mechs from the famed Steiner factories.

User comment

This sequel to the earlier House Steiner (The Lyran Commonwealth) is the penultimate volume in the FIeld Manuals series for BattleTech to be published by FASA. It follows much the same format as the other Field Manuals in that it focuses largely on the military structure of the Capellan Confederation before introducing a scattering of new equipment and units. Suiting the original Steiner theme in the fluff, all of the new discoveries are biased towards the heavy end of the spectrum, and consist of such things as Heavy Gauss Rifles, a new Assault 'Mech, and the largest Warship ever constructed in the Inner Sphere.

This sourcebook is out of print, and hasn't been released in an electronic format by the new license holder, That makes this one of the harder to find Field Manuals.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Le Franc-Tireur #13: The Crimean Campaign
description:
Issue 13 of the popular French (although English language) ASL magazine focuses on the Crimean campaign, from the German invasion to the Russian counteroffensive of 1944.

Also included are a Berlin Red Vengeance strategy guide, as well as 17 scenarios and an overlay, thus a thicker issue than the regular 80 page LFT magazine.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: VOR: The Maelstrom – Shard
description:
All Carbons Must Die!

Eternally vengeful, the Shard scour the Maelstrom with only one objective-the utter destruction of all carbon based life forms. Pure hatred fuels their relentless war and their jagged crystalline husks are the only weaponry they need to wreak their havoc. By channeling their cores of pure energy, the Shard unleash piercing lasers, disruptive force fields and epic blasts from the dreaded matrix cannon to lay waste to any and all who are unfortunate enough to be caught in their whirlwind of rage.

The Shard Forcebook describes the hostile and hellbent forces of the Shard, providing background on the tragic history of this advanced race and how imprisonment within the Maelstrom has forced them to "devolve." The Shard forcelist offers new units such as concussors, ambients, primes, the god-like axions, and the devastating eradicator war machine. This book also contains a Shard Battle Terrain Table, new campaign rules, force traits and five new Shard personalities who are especially efficient at reducing carbons to dust.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Syrtis
description:
Syrtis is an abstract strategy game inspired by the undersea quicksands of the Mediterranean. Players strive to consolidate their territory as the board steadily sinks beneath the waves.

Each player has two towers which move on connected groups of tiles of that player's shape or color. Players use the towers to sink tiles (i.e., remove them from the board). As more tiles sink, players can slide the remaining tiles through the resulting empty spaces.

A player wins when all the remaining tiles of that player's shape are connected, or when the remaining tiles of that player's color are connected. A player can also win by sinking four tiles while the opponent sinks none.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Pegasus Bridge Expansion
description:
The second "chapter" expansion for Sergeants Miniatures Game: Red Devils. Requires Red Devils to play; further, one scenario requires "X-Terrain" (X-1, 2, 3 and 4) and rewards having Commonwealth tactics modules "Parachute Infantry Infiltration" and "Parachute Infantry Battle Patrol," but does not require them.

From the back of the box:

On the Night of June 6, 1944, the British 6th Airborne Division parachuted into Normandy between the Orne estuary and the Dives River and marshes. The initial attack was a coup-de-main glider assault on Pegasus Bridge, but it was not the only action taken against bridges that night. All over the region, British Paratroopers slipped through the night to capture or destroy bridges and strongholds, key to control of the battlefield.

Along the way, they fought in endless skirmishes against garrison and Ost troops, as well as Panzergrenadiers. At times they were met by alert enemies, but more often, the Red Devils were a surprise to the Germans. As part of the storyline for Red Devils, we have included a mini campaign - Glider No. 4 - the lost glider from the Pegasus Bridge Attack.

Packed full of new Story and Order cards, alongside 18 action filled scenarios, expands the battles of the British Paratroopers facing off against the German occupational forces in Normandy.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board

name: Combat Leader: East Front '41
description:
From the publisher's website:

Combat Leader: East Front is the foundational game of the series, and contains all game components and standard rules (plus advanced options) necessary to play. Players command a single German or Russian squad in rural (and varied) terrain during the initial months of Operation Barbarossa in 1941. Besides the supplied scenarios, there is an almost limitless number of situations you can design on your own.

Soldiers are armed with various weapons, which include the German GewehrK98K Mauser rifle, MP38 machine pistol, and MG 34 light machine gun, and the Russian Mosin Nagant M1891/30 rifle, PPSh-41 machine pistol, and DP 1928 light machine gun. Each weapon has its own characteristics for range, penetration, effectiveness, and reliability. Enough men are supplied (33 for each side) to fit out squads of many different varieties.

Supplied scenarios include: Clash of Squads (CL1), Meeting Engagement (CL2), Hotel Henn (CL3), Scamble at Dusk (CL4), Reconnaissance in Force (CL5), and Breakthrough (CL6). Each scenario has its own victory conditions, special rules, and play variants.

The game comes complete with Map 1 & Map 2 (8.5"x11" each), German counter set A (60 counters & markers), Russian counter set B (60 counters & markers), two identical double-sided Reference Cards, three double-sided Scenario Cards (with six scenarios), and 12-page illustrated rule booklet.

name: Redemption Prize
description:
DESCRIPTION:
Your family is away on vacation and having a blast. Unfortunately, your big sister was not able to come along. Since you're at the arcade for the afternoon, you've decided to get her the best prize you can in the redemption center to bring home. Your family thinks that is a great idea, and wants to do the same.

Since your family is a little competitive, everyone wants to get the most tickets for the best prize. It's game on!

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Gain as many redemption tickets as possible by playing games with your limited coins

GAMEPLAY:
Players play games of various difficulty by matching squares based upon color, shape, and numbers. Half of the players will be active each turn. Each turn is timed, so players have a limited time to complete matches. The more matches made, the higher the prize.

GAME ELEMENTS:

Timed card matching
Variable game difficulty, with higher risk/rewards
Each player is active (at least) every other turn
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Secrets of the Lost Tomb: 3 Epic Bosses
description:
Three promo Epic Boss cards for Secrets of the Lost Tomb. These came in a cross-promo packet with 'Argent: Promo Pack #1' and are replacements for the matching cards in the original game. These new ones just have alternate abilities and tougher game play values.

According to SotLT creator, Christopher Batarlis, "They were originally part of a Kickstarter promotion with Level 99 Games. They gave us some cards from Argent the Consortium to put in Secrets and Vice Versa. We also had a few extras and gave them out to people at Gencon 2015.

They can be substituted out for the originals! They're a bit more challenging."

The three Epic Bosses are:

Rhaz Azul Ahamet

The Forsaken King

Herathulhu
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blucher: War to the Death
description:
From the game web site:

War to the Death is the second expansion set for Blücher. It is a boxed set of 216 unit cards, covering the armies of the Peninsular Wars and a great many extras. War to the Death is all you need to create Scharnhorst campaigns for the Peninsular theatre or for any game involving the British, Spanish, French, or their allied armies.

From the back of the box:

This set contains unit cards for every unit type in the French, British, and Spanish army lists as well as all the personality cards and the Spanish Guerilla.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Catan: Das Duell – Sonderkarte 2017: Isabell, die Handelsagentin
description:
Bonus Card for "Die Fürsten von Catan".

Isabell, die Handelsagentin must be put next to a wool- or ore-ship. In your turn, you may swap 1:1 with this ship.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Wolfsburg
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing

description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Neon Limbo: Redemption
description:
You play a long-retired knight of the once great but now disbanded knightly Order. Since becoming former knights, you and your remaining companions have been operating a modest bar together. One night, you have all been rudely awoken by threatening events and false accusations of mysterious origin. Split up and on the run, chased by agents of dangerous organizations and other threats to your peaceful retirement, you must hastily travel in secret across the realm and unravel the conspiracy.

Neon Limbo: Redemption is a competitive game with some “common threat” elements. It is played over a fixed number of rounds, divided across three Chapters. Each round, you travel from location to location and choose from encounters of various degrees of difficulty to resolve. Encounters represent character choices and their resolution defines your character's personal path, traits, and story. By resolving encounters you can gather Support in the realm, but may also attract negative attention in the form of Glow tokens.

The goal is to acquire the most Influence Points while avoiding accumulating too many Glow tokens which may cause you to lose in the end.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: ¡Adiós Calavera!: The Three Player Expansion
description:
With ¡Adios Calavera!: The Three Player Expansion, unlike in the normal two-person version of the game, each player chooses from their seven figures three with special abilities and two without, then places these on the hexagonal game board.

The gameplay stays more or less the same, with the first player who manages to move all their discs to the opposite area winning the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Point to Point Movement

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Neumünster
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Street Masters: Mr. Apple
description:
KS Exclusive

Contains:
1 Miniature + Rival/Ally card
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dragonfire: Fighter Half-Orc Promo Card
description: 2018 Origins Convention promo character screen. The artwork is the same as the base set, however, this promo screen has a Feature "Savage Endurance" only found on this promo and already pre-printed.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Horse & Musket VI: Sunset of an Era
description:
With the final defeat of Napoléon Bonaparte, a new conservative era of anti-liberal and anti-republican politics began in Europe. It was a false dawn for the forces of reaction. In the Americas, Spain’s empire evaporated in a series of rebellions. The defeat of the republicans led to a renewal in great power struggles, such as the Crimean War, and nationalist and expansionist wars. The middle of the century saw the unification of Italy and Germany through warfare. America, wracked by division over slavery, politics, and economics, was ripped apart by a civil war that ended in the reunification of the nation.

The great changes in government and ideology were matched by a shift towards industrialized war. By the 1850s railroads, telegraphs, and photographs were changing the face of battle. The smoothbore flintlock was replaced by the rifled musket, which was in turn replaced with repeating rifles. The era of linear combat, the basic tactics of western warfare for thousands of years, now gave way to a looser form of warfare, where technology was as important as training and generals. It was the end of an era.

The battles included are...

Ayacucho - December 9, 1824 – “If from Romulus, Rome; from Bolívar, it is Bolivia.”

The Alamo - March 6, 1836 – “What are the lives of soldiers, than so many chickens?”

Mudki - December 18, 1845 – Opening Battle of the First Anglo-Sikh War

Buena Vista - February 23, 1847 – “Tell him to give ‘em hell!”

Cerro Gordo - April 17-18, 1847 – “Mexico no longer has an army.”

Novara - March 22, 1849 – The Abdication of Charles Albert I

Balaclava - October 25, 1854 – “There, my lord, is your enemy! There are your guns!”

Inkerman - November 5, 1854 – “I tell you, we gave ‘em a hell of a towelling.”

Second Sevastopol - September 8, 1855 – “I’m here, and I shall stay here.”

Solferino - June 24, 1859 – The Birth of the Red Cross

Volturno - October 1, 1860 – “Victory all along the Line!”

First Bull Run - July 21, 1861 – “There is Jackson standing like a stone wall.”

Second Bull Run - August 28-30, 1862 – The Confederacy at Flood Tide

Antietam - September 17, 1862 – The Bloodiest Day of the American Civil War

Irish Bend - April 14, 1863 – “Grover had stopped just short of the prize.”
