This cardgame is a multi-player solitaire. The deck consists of 96 cards (hence the name), 6 of each in the numbers 1 through 16. You can be as many players as you like, but each players will need his own deck.

One player shuffles his deck and draws the cards, one by one, telling the others what he drew, so all players will get their cards out in the same order (similar mechanic to Take it Easy).

The point is to build stacks of cards going from 1 to 16. When the last card is drawn points are awarded for how many complete stacks you've managed to build.

name: Fran Tarkenton's Pro Football
description:
Fran Tarkenton's Pro Football was a playable yet highly detailed simulation of pro football in the days before the NFL and AFL consolidated. (Tarkenton was a New York Giant quarterback at the time – before he led the Vikings to three Super Bowls.)

The game was advanced for the time, and very much a simulation. The game used 23 offensive basic plays and 8 defensive lines. Unlike some contemporaries and many lesser football games, the proper defense will limit the damage of a great roll. Despite the limited number of offensive plays, there are plenty of choices since the plays can showcase feature positions. Also, beyond the 8 defensive setups, the defensive player can also have the choice of which player to 'key' on. Of course, double-covering the wrong receiver will allow a lesser roll to have a higher result.

The true advancement for the game system was the yearly 'rating' of each team on their defensive and offensive line in each of these plays. Thus, when you played two teams, there was a die roll modifier for each play based on each defense.

The clock functions were also very good, allowing a true 'two minute drill' and the use of real game strategies.

Fran Tarkenton's Pro Football is a great time capsule with a look at the teams in the 1960s, before they merged to become the NFC and AFC.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Dai Shogi
description: Dai (or great) shogi is one of several large Shogi games that date from the Middle Ages of Japan. It is thought to be a precursor of today's standard shogi game. It is played on a 15×15 board. Each player starts the game with sixty-five pieces of twenty-nine different types. Unlike shogi, dai shogi does not permit "drops".

name: At Close Quarters
description: Skirmish Wargame rules for 20th to early 21st century special forces operations and other small unit actions.
publishers: Brigade Games, HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company), Rattrap Productions LLC

name: Pelotera
description:
Pelotera is a very unique game.

Have two main components:

50x70 cm board
2 dice.


Each player represents a soccer team and participates in a soccer game with other player. Each time you roll the dice you will be able to get closer to make a goal, but in the way anything can happen.

For Ages 7 and up

name: Photo-opoly
description:
No one takes a picture of something they want to forget! Make a game that is unforgettable! Where are your photos anyway? Photo albums? Stored on the memory card of your digital camera? Stuffed in shoe boxes under the bed?

CALLING ALL PHOTOS! COME OUT AND PLAY! Choose 22 favorite photos and create a game for: A BIRTHDAY, A FAMILY REUNION, A WEDDING, A PARTY, A BABY SHOWER, AN ANNIVERSARY, ANY CELEBRATION, ANY EVENT. You don’t even really need an occasion!

Maybe you’ve just always wanted to make your own game! Materials and instructions included for creating your game in many different ways.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dodge Bowl
description:
Dodge Bowl is a novel dexterity game from Nash Games. In this you set-up 5 'bowling' pins on your side of the board and 3 blocking cubes in the center of the board.
The object is to knock down your opponents pins first. This is done by rolling a marble through a curved tube from your side of the board. The rules are simple and the game is a fun way to pass the time.

name: The Battle of the Nile
description:
The Battle of the Nile - 1st and 2nd August, 1798
There are four different Scenarios that can be played, namely the Historical Scenario ( which simulates what actually happened in the Battle of the Nile ) and three other Scenarios called Scenario A, Scenario B and Scenario C.

The Board is a grid of flat up hexagonal zones, measuring 52 rows by 44 columns. The Board represents an area of approximately 2.5 miles by 1.9 miles at the North West part of Aboukir Bay.

Each counter represents one ship-of-the-line. There are 14 British ships and 13 French ships, each identified by their national flags and their names. Each ship counter spans two hexes.

name: Murder at the Four Deuces
description:
from the Publisher's website:

Murder At The Four Deuces is a rip roaring 1920's gangster murder mystery party game with lots of murder, bribery & back stabbing to be had.

This game is loosely based on some of the very first Chicago & New York Gangsters, their rivalries, speakeasies and love lives. Al Capone was just moving up in the 'Family'.

Don and MeMe Wannabe are hosting the grand opening celebration for their new Juice Joint, The Four Deuces, and you are invited to attend. The Four Deuces is a lavish joint serving booze and music in the front. In the back is the game room and upstairs is a very high class and exclusive brothel (no brothel in the teen rated version). The cream and not so cream of society will be here. With gangsters, politicians, dolls, molls and many other interesting guests in attendance this event is sure to be the bee's knees.

Home Page: http://www.dinnerandamurder.com/games/4deuces.htm
publishers: Dinner and a Murder Mystery Games LLC

name: Red Star / Blue Sky: Battles Over the Eastern Front 1941-1944
description:
From the manual:

Red Star / Blue Sky is a collection of scenarios, campaign systems, aircraft data cards and new rules for use with the Red Sun, Blue Sky or Black Cross, Blue Sky miniatures games. Red Star, Blue Sky accurately recreates tactical aerial combat on the Russian Front during World War II. Simple game mechanics lets you focus on leading a squadron or more of aircraft against the hated enemy aircraft and ground forces.

Expands:

Red Sun / Blue Sky: Aerial Combat in the Pacific and South East Asia, 1938-1942
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: L'Arbre de Mako
description: In this game, you add to the tree and attempt to be the one to get rid of all your pieces. During the game you take turns placing branches on the tree, leaves on branches, bees and butterflies on the leaves and flowers. You are building the tree in 3-D, but the game is basically a tile laying game using a die roll to control which element is placed.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Hannibal: The War of the Kings
description:
The game is played on an 8x8 grid. Each opponent has 1 king, and they share 9 pieces of each of 5 colours.

Each turn, a player moves their king 1 space orthogonally or diagonally and adds 1 coloured block to the board. The first player to surround the opponent's king wins. This basic version is very close to Isolation. Differences: You add pieces instead of taking them away. The board size is larger (8x8 instead of 6x8). There are fewer pieces (45 instead of 46).

The advanced version allows a player to escape if there are two pieces of the same colour adjacent to the king. The game continues until no such escape is possible.

name: A Knight of Murder
description:
From the publisher's website:

Hear ye! Hear ye! All ye Kings & Queens, Knights & Nobles!

It is an evening of Medieval Madness planned to honor the noble marriage of Baron Bartholomew to the Lady Diana of Dunnsberry. From the notorious knights to the seedy sheriff, the conniving chambermaid to the meddling maids, all the subjects of the manor are not only invited, but ordered to be here by command of the lord. With all of the secrets in the manor, it is hard to tell who will live through the night-- for any betrayal to the lord or the king IS punishable by death.

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
Manor Announcements— to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the happenings in the manor and the guests coming to the reunion.
Laws of the Land Poster— a poster to be hung up at the party explaining more about medieval times and how King Kyle rules his lands.
21 Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
21 Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
21 Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical guest, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FOR UP TO 80 GUESTS!
10-15 GUESTS -- 15-21 GUESTS -- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/A_Knight_of_Murder.php
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Murder in Margaritaland
description:
From the publisher's website:

A Night of Crime and Chaos in the Caribbean.

Every night if a party in Margaritaland, the most exclusive tropical resort on the island! While most choose this vacation destination to escape their troubles, for one individual it will mean the end of their travels altogether. Join the rich, the famous and the resort staff to decipher the clues and catch a culprit in the act of killing!

This mystery is formatted to be able to be run indoors or out! Perfect for pool parties, summer BBQs, beach parties, you name it!

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
The Island Review— to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the happenings in and around the island and the guests coming to the party.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical guest, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FOR UP TO 80 GUESTS!
10-15 GUESTS -- 15-20 GUESTS -- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/Murder_in_Margaritaland.php
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Jackson's Foot Cavalry
description:
Jackson's Foot Cavalry

The game will a block game with point to point movement covering Stonewall Jackson's classic 1862 Valley Campaign. The game system will be using our Forged in Fire rules with adjustments for the situation facing both Union and Confederate commanders in the Shenandoah Valley. Supply and surprise will be critical as Jackson races up and down the Valley fighting one Union force after another as the Union try to trap the Confederates. The game will include a main campaign as well as several shorter scenarios. Playable in 3-4 hours for the full campaign with 1-2 hours for scenarios. Victory is determined by how many Union troops the Confederate player can force the Union player to keep in the Valley. The Union player will try to keep the bare minimum of troops in the Valley to prevent the Confederate player from obtaining certain objectives.

According to Worthington's June 1, 2011 update this game will be the first in a series including games on the Vicksburg, Gettysburg, Overland, and Atlanta campaigns as well as an update of Forged in Fire: The 1862 Peninsula Campaign.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame

name: Jace Pearson's Tales of the Texas Rangers
description: Based on "Tales of the Texas Rangers," a western adventure old-time radio drama that aired on the NBC radio network from 1950-1952, starring Joal McCrea and directed by Stacey Keach, Sr. The series was adapted for television and aired in the late 1950's, starring Willard Parker.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sweeps
description:
Listed in American Games.


4197. 1945, Hand with money cover. Sports, Horseracing, Board game



4198. 1945, Man in polka dot suit cover. Sports, Horseracing, Board game



4199. 1945, Three players with money cover. Sports, Horseracing, Board game


Game based on the famous Sweepstakes race run in Ireland. The object of the game is to,of course, win the Sweepstakes Race.

The game comes with 1 die, 4 colored horses with wooden stands, 25 colored markers and 1000 dollars [NOTE: Unknown how many colored cardboard markers and how much money present indicates a complete game. My copy came with a sheet of 27 (9x3) brown markers in addition to 25 already cut-out markers - were 2 sheets of each color provided? Additionally the rules state that each player starts with $1,900 (not $1,000) broken out into 16 $100 bills, 4 $50 bills and 20 $5 bills, meaning there should be at least 64 $100 bills, 16 $50 bills and 80 $5 bills in a complete set, maybe more]. Players move around the board contributing money into the Sweepstakes purse. buying horses, and buying sweepstakes tickets.

If a player lands on a square already owned by another player, the player makes a side bet of 5.00 by paying the fee to the owner of the horse. If that horse eventually wins the owner must pay off the bettor at odds shown below the name and price of his horse.

A player must be on the yellow circuit of the board in order to win. If a roll puts his marker past the "winning post" square on his first time around he must go around the circuit once more. As he hears the 'Winning Post" position a 2nd time he must stop if a roll were to take him past the square and then on another turn re-roll and try again to hit the Winning Post square by exact roll. If he does he takes all the money in the Sweeps Fund, pays off all bets on his horse and then wins the game.

name: Hatchlings
description:
Hatchlings
A fantasy themed game in which each player controls 5 characters and attempts to move them across a field of nasty, giant, grub like hatchlings. The hatchlings appear in random locations on each and every turn. Creature tiles appear on the field through the use of randomly drawn coordinate cards.
The 5 characters you control have different movement abilities and different defense abilities.
Each character has a value and the winner is the player who successfully maneuvers the highest number of his characters across the field without them being eaten.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Conflict 2000
description:
Conflict 2000 :Modern Combat Rules takes the rules used in Stellar Conflicts & Uprisings, and uses them to depict combat between modern forces, from the 1970's up to 2000 (and beyond). Using hidden counters, tactical movement and simultaneous combat, Conflict 2000 keeps all players actively involved during the game. Conflict 2000 incorporates rules for vehicles, artillery, engineer support, leadership and experience, all of which can be of vital importance in determining the outcome.

Designed to use miniatures from any manufacturer, Conflict 2000 players can choose between the 25mm scale, for more detailed, personal combat, or 15mm for platoon-level action with more vehicles.


(from the Tactical Command website): "The main strategy of the rules system CONFLICT 2000 is to give a feel for the modern forces and their basic combat configuration as for troop’s equipment and armor vehicles. We at Tactical Command Games firmly believe that the acronym (METT-T) Missions, Equipment, Troops, Terrain and Time, will dictate situations on the modern battlefields. So with that in mind go ahead and have fun playing the game."

name: Stellar Fire
description:
Stellar Fire is a space-combat miniatures game, handling battles of any size from single ship-to-ship, all the way up to massive fleets. Using a hidden counter tactical movement system and simultaneous combat, Stellar Fire keeps all players active and involved, minimizing downtime. Stellar Fire is designed to work with any miniatures on the market!

With five unique alien races and three separate human factions, Stellar Fire's scenario generator ensures that your games will never get stale.

Web site
http://site.tacticalcommandgames.com/

name: Stellar Conflicts & Uprisings
description:
The ground combat companion to Tactical Command Games' spaceship combat Rules Stellar Fire, Stellar Conflicts & Uprisings takes the same game concepts and applies them to squad and platoon level infantry combat (but can be played up to company level). Includes rules for vehicles, engineer support, and artillery.

SC&U uses hidden counter movement, spotting attempts and simultaneous combat rules designed to keep all players involved and active during play.

Like Stellar Fire, SC&U's rich universe with 5 alien races and three human factions are used by an included scenario generator to create a endless amount of interesting game setups.

name: Kanzlerwahl
description:
"Kanzlerwahl" is completely described in the small magazine "Wahlspiele", a special edition of the "Pöppel Revue" published on the occasion of the SPIEL 1995 in Essen.
"Kanzlerwahl" means election of the chancellor. All players start with multi-functional cards and some money. The game is played in several rounds. First 3 candidates will be determined by the possession of specific cards. All players will have 5 minutes for negotiating and trading. Then all candidates will held a speech and announce their political program. They are allowed to lie. All players vote with their cards. The candidate with the absolute majority will be chancellor. If there is no absolute majority, there will be an additional election between the favorites. The chancellor receives his salary and announces his future politics. All players with adequate cards will receive a corresponding income. The game ends after several rounds when a player has reached a specific amount of money.

name: Battle of Britain
description:
The Battle of Britain was the German attempt to gain air supremacy before launching their planned invasion of Britain - "OPERATION SEA LION".

In Call Sign 7's Battle of Britain game you can play as either side in this crucial conflict, and see how things may have gone differently if you had been there. Commanding your aircraft on the unique multi-tiered combat arena you can choose to:-

Represent England
Will you defend your country at all costs during this desperate time? Succeed and you will deliver Hitler his first major defeat, paving the way to the D-Day invasion and the destruction of the Thousand Year Reich.

Represent Germany
Follow the orders issued by Reichmarshall Hermann Goering on the 30th of June 1940 and destroy the Royal Air Force! After all, the odds are in your favour 3 to 1. Can you change history and do your countrymen proud? Clear the skies of the British pest and open the door for the coming invasion. Word has it, this time next year you'll be holidaying on the very ground you fought over (with the added bonus of promotion).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Grandgammon
description:
From the rules book:

Grandgammon is a game combining both skill and luck for two to six players. When the game is played by two people it is identical to the game known as backgammon.

Grandgammon is an extension of backgammon permitting the game to be played by more than two players.

Online Play


Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Three Crowns
description: Three Crowns is a sophisticated game of pattern-formation, which was designed by Larry Back in 2000 for the 2001 8x8 Game Design Competition co-sponsored by About Board Games, Abstract Games magazine and the Strategy Gaming Society. Every game is a sharp battle. The goal is to crown your pieces, then to build a "crowned troika", a formation of three or more crowned pieces in a straight line, orthogonally or diagonally, all belonging to the same player.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Giog
description:
Giog uses Xiangqi Pieces but no board. All players help to scramble the 32 pieces face down and distribute the pieces evenly to themselves. If the number of players is three, the winner of the previous game or a volunteer receives 12 pieces and the other two players receive 10 pieces each. Like a Mahjong game, each player arranges his/her pieces into one line with half of the pieces on top of the other half.

Play is very similar to the Western card game 'Hearts', inasmuch as players reveal pieces in turn and whoever has the highest ranking piece being the winner. Should there be a tie among some players, they apply the same procedures again by revealing more lower pieces until the order is finally determined.

The player who played the strongest combinations of a same type (as what the round-starter played) wins that round. If there is a tie, the round-starter always wins, or the order of players determines the winner. For example, if the first and fourth player play the same combinations, first player wins unless fourth player is the round-starter. The winner of a round collects the won pieces and starts a new round. The game is played until all pieces are exhausted. The game will go to the player who wins most pieces.

Other versions of this game are known as Sānbèi qí (三倍其: triple game), Dǎ qí luò (打棋摞: playing chess stacks), Chēlún qí zhàn (車輪棋戰: wheel chess battle) or Jū mǎ pāo (車馬包): chariot-horse-cannon, which is one of the noble three-piece combinations) or Sang Krip. A related but somewhat different game Zhì hǔ (擲虎 : throw dragon), also known as Sān guó (三國 : three kingdoms) is played in Taiwan.
Details on rules: https://www.pagat.com/multitrk/giog.html

name: Home Court Basketball
description: Card driven Basketball game from 1955. The cover has a picture of Charlie Eckman a National Basketball referee who became the head coach of the Zollner Pistons. Charlie was featured in the Saturday Evening Post, Time, and Sports Ilustrated.

name: Grillin-opoly
description:
from the publisher's website:

Fire up!

Half a million years ago, either by design or by accident, humans began to cook meat over fire – and we’ve been grilling ever since! In fact, grilling has become one of our most universally enjoyed human experiences. We grill year round, from the East Coast to the West Coast, shoveling snow, swatting flies, huddled under umbrellas, whatever heroics required to keep the fires stoked.

Grillin’-opoly is a game celebrating this fiery phenomenon. Players buy favorite grillin’ properties, then increase their property value by collecting Briquets, and trading them in for Propane Tanks. It sounds easy enough, but lose your License to Grill, have to kiss the cook, or get sent to Burnt to a Crisp, and it becomes a little more difficult…and a lot more fun!

So advance to Fire Up! Who knows! You may soon be designated “Natural Born Griller,” – or you may be diggin’ your burned dog out of the pit! Whatever happens, Grillin’-opoly is a rare treat for all who appreciate THE THRILL OF THE GRILL!

6 custom tokens: Salt Shaker, Corn on the Cob, Hot Dog, Cheeseburger, T-Bone Steak, Pepper
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dutchman, Spaniard, Switzer, Swede
description:
The game is designed to cover land warfare in Europe 1618-1660. The emphasis is on continental warfare rather than the English Civil War. Scale in one inch = 40 yards for 15mm figures, one figure = 50 men and each turn represents 30-45 minutes.

The basic unit is a regiment or brigade sized unit depending on the national force being represented. These are then organized into Division which are in turn organized into Wings. Two or more wings is an army. During play each unit receives a number of actions called Operations depending on a variety of situation factors. These are then used to execute movement and other tactical operations.

The rules provide diagrams of historical formations, army lists, and scenarios for the battles of Lutzen (1632), Jankow (1645 -- erroneously listed as 1635 in the contents page) and Anfangsthal (1644). A separate expansion, called for God, King, Pulk and Orta provides additional optional rules as well as additional army lists for Eastern Europe and the English Civil War.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Ruined Urthe: A Djarhun Expansion
description:
The Demon Tzerar had slain Gharad and taken the Book of Avrakar. The entire land of Djarhun has been put into chaos. Lakes of fire have consumed most of Djarhun, and only Durach remains...broken. Tzerar has proclaimed his domain be called Urthe, where he rules with a ruthless hand. Wars have raged for centuries to try to regain the lands. Technomancers and Mages have been wiped out in separate wars that only solidified Tzerar’s power. Gems have lost almost all value and the few that live, just try to survive on what they find. The great City of Elidor has been long forgotten, as Tzerar’s castle now rests in its place. The world, that was known by all, would surely be lost if not for one thing … none of this happened yet.

Welcome to the land of Ruined Urthe. The expansion, to the Djarhun fantasy board game, can send Heroes on a journey 1,000 years into the future of Djarhun. Explore the land that will come to be … if only you do not get to the Book of Avrakar in time. This land holds new secrets and foes, as you travel the wastelands in search of artifacts that will aid you in the present. Along with a new board to explore and updated rules, there are also new cards to add to the adventure...

• Hero Cards (11)

• Market Cards (36)

• Treasure Cards (110)

• Quest Cards (190)

Expands:

Djarhun
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Ancient Wargaming
description:
From the editor's introduction:

In this "Ancient Wargaming" book, Phil Barker (a founder member of the Wargames Research Group) sets out to introduce the fascinations of the period to the novitiate ancient wargamer. He describes not only the troop types, weapons and tactics of the period, but also shows how to begin amassing armies of wargame figures which are balanced in their composition, and how to use these same armies to win ancient battles on the tabletop using the Wargames Research Group Ancient Rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Pigeon Poop
description:
Mr. Boneyhead is late for work. He just lives down the road from his office. It'd be all so easy except for the pesky pigeon who has taken such a dislike to him.

As the pigeon you must drive Mr. Boneyhead off the street's end. Use any of the tricks that your cards may allow you or... well... use what nature gave you in the end.

As Mr. Boneyhead you must make it to work period. Use your umbrella and whatever the street offers up to you in order to get there. And if you're of a nasty frame of mind... pluck that pigeon's feathers for him. Take enough from his tail and he'll leave you alone while the other birds laugh at his fashion faux pas.

Pigeon Poop... you're in my sights now.

name: BackRound
description:
From The Intro - What is a BackRound? A BackRound is a word pronounced backwards. For example: the BackRound for 'table' is 'leb-bait'. Some BackRounds are made up of actual words like 'eat-is' (which is the word 'city', pronounced backwards).

The first player to collect 5 cards (if team play you must collect 10 cards) wins the game.

name: Press Your Luck
description: A fast-paced family game played with eight, 8-sided dice with similarities to the games Farkel and Fill or Bust! Players strive to roll three or more of a kind or a one, five, or straight. Bonuses and busts help or hinder the player on their way to be the first to score 10,000 points.

name: Houserules Napoleonics
description: Tactical Napoleonic rules for miniatures.

name: The Sword and the Flame: Eight Hundred Fighting Englishmen
description:
Tactical colonial miniatures rules.

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
publishers: And That's The Way It Was...

name: Honour and Fortune
description: Interesting umpired miniatures ruleset based on Colonial campaigns in India in the 19th Century.

name: Spend Government Spend
description: Roll and move board game produced in 1981 by Rolger inc. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 12 and up.

name: BattleMech Recognition Cards
description:
Published in 1993, these cards gather up Mech designs from a large variety of previous BattleTech products and put them into an easy to use format that speeds up the set-up process.

Expands:

BattleTech
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Scourge!:The Search for the Bloodkey
description:
From the Publishers' website
"Scourge! is the first game in our line of Make-Your-Own games. When you receive your book cut it out and assemble it yourself and your ready to play. In the game af Scourge! you take on the role of a cult member bent on taking control after the mysterious death of your leader. Build an army of street thugs and demons and amass a library of spells to defeat your enemies while battling in the crowded alleys of a Victorian Metropolis."
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Caterpiggily
description:
In Caterpiggily, players take turns drawing duel-colored tiles which represent sections of a caterpillars body, and placing the like colors next to each other thus building the caterpillar. Player continue around the table placing their tiles until one player has no more tiles to place. This player then places the head and is declared the winner.

User Summary:

A fun game for 4 to 12 year-olds where you match colors from you hand to form a caterpillar. The goal of the game is to be the first to place his or her last card thus having the privilege of placing the head of the caterpillar. Each player starts with 5 cards. Each card has two colors. Each player matches the color at the end of the caterpillar with the color on one of their cards. If they don't have the color they have to draw until they get it. If all of the cards run out and you still don't have the color you have to pass.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: NoGlobal
description:
NoGlobal is for 2-5 players, and each player takes on a different role—President, policeman, demonstrator, or violent protester—and each role has a different win condition: the President wants to visit three monuments in town, the violent protester has to throw a tart at the President, and so on.

NoGlobal is available for download through Arima.it.

(information from www.boardgamenews.com)

name: Balls a Poppin
description: Action dexterity game where the players shoot balls towards a goal "ala Gnip Gnop" but attempt to get four in a row of their color either vertically, horizontally or diagonally "ala connect four".

name: Games to Play: Board and Table Games for All the Family
description:
From the back cover

A fascinating collection of over 130 of the world's most entertaining board and table games, both ancient and modern. Twenty games are beautifully reproduced in their original form complete with instructions, tactics and rules for all the family to play actually on the pages of the book.

Games of position and race, war games and word games, chess and dominoes, mancala and fortune-telling games -- all are included in this superb compendium. Wei-Chi from China, Seega from Egypt, Burmese Chess, Conglak from Indonesia, Hnefatafl from Scandinavia are among the less familiar but games of Ludo, Bagatelle and Blackjack are here too.

More than the games themselves, a wealth of historical information and the opportunity to discover an extraordinary variety of age-old games make this book invaluable to the serious collector of games as well as the games enthusiast.

ISBN-13: 9780718129934
ISBN-10: 0718129938

name: Die Giganten der Strasse
description: French cycling game that was also released in a German edition. The game is presented in a big (42x33cm) plastic suitcase that contains all components. It features 12 cyclist riders (they are 6 cm high, which is rather big) in 6 different colours, thus 2 riders per team. As in most racing games, the goal is to reach the finish first with your riders.

name: Farm Management
description:
The players are farm owners in the rural United States of the 1960s. By growing crowing crops, raising cattle, selling grain, and efficiently managing resources, farm owners strive to have the wealthiest (or least in debt) farm at the end of three years.

The game is presented as a farm simulator, designed to help farmers learn more about the business of farming and train them to make successful business decisions. Many of the instructions are actually advice that could be applied towards running a real farm, and the box cover advertises, "Test Farm Plans, Teach Better Management, Learn Farming Methods".

name: Periplus
description:
Simple Tactical level Board & card game for 2 players. Simulate battles between two small fleets of Greek style Warships. Each figure represents a single Ship. No dice. Use cards to move, attack, and defend. A complete copy of the rules are available for free at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Periplus.html

name: Lazo
description: Lazo is an abstract tile placing game. The object is to form a loop, either on the board surface or 3-dimensionally. The tiles stack like cannonballs. The board is a grid of triangular holes, in the overall shape of a trapezoid.

name: Bizerte Gertie
description:
from CELEBRATING BOARD GAMES by Nina Chertoff and Susan Kahn.

This is a game that could only come from a different era.

Bertie Gertie is a game for 4 players, all servicemen on leave during World War II. Their goal is to take a walk with a beautiful woman on the beach. The object of the game is not to be the player left with the "ugly" one. The token game piece for that "ugly" girl was a "dog".

name: Police Patrol
description: Police Patrol by Hasbro is a simple spin and move game where the object of the game is to watch out for unlawful or dangerous incidents that occur on your watch. You score points by dealing with things like Lost Children, Accidents, Traffic Violations and Robberies. Game comes with a plastic police car, 5 policemen, a cardboard town complete with police station and 3 spinners which determine what happens during the game.

name: Flying Swordsmen
description:
An abstract game played on two chessboards and with stackable reversible counters. The boards are seen as flip-sides of each other (like sides of a coin), one player starts setup in the center of one side, the other in the center of the other side, with the goal being to have only your markers on the other player's side. Pieces can move farther and jump more adjacent pieces if they are stacked (up to 3 high). If pieces are jumped over they are either converted to the other color or eliminated, depending on how many pieces have been jumped over.

Full rules at: https://web.archive.org/web/20070504174755/http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=24

name: White Collar Battle
description:
Each player has a business card, in fact it should be a USA business card since zip-codes are mentioned in the rules. Each player will select some dice, and roll them -- trying to get sets. They can augment their sets by crossing out numbers on their business card, and they damage other players by knocking numbers on their opponents business cards. You're KOed if you have no numbers left, last card "standing" wins.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=40

name: Countin' Mountain
description: The game teaches addition and subtraction concepts using mountain bikers and snowboarders on a vertical board, which appeals to reluctant learners, especially boys. The graphics are part of the appeal to help the kids get hooked on learning basic math.

name: Wolkenkinder
description: Wolkenkinder is a dice game for children three and up. The players assume the role of children, who live up in the clouds, called the wolkenkinder. The wolkenkinder like to play their favorite new game- dropping raindrops into a rain barrel. The game is made more challenging by the umbrellas that block the holes in the rain barrel. The first wolkenkinder to drop all their raindrops into the rain barrel wins the game.

name: Skatebirds Game
description:
A roll and move racing game that feature TV cartoon characters on roller skates.

Features characters from the TV show "The Skatebirds" including Moe, Larry and Curly; The Three Robotic Stooges.

Object: Be the first player to reach the Treehouse Studio.

From the box: The zany Skatebirds scurry around trying to organize their TV show. ScatCat does all that he can to foul up the Skatebirds plans. He has built a marble slide at the Treehouse and does his best to stop the Skateboard.

name: Dinosaur Dash
description: This is a children's game themed on dinosaurs. Players roll their dice and compete to move their set of 4 dinosaurs to safety.

name: NI-SHI-KI -shouden-
description:
NI-SHI-KI -Shouden- is a pocket sized version of NI-SHI-KI: The Sliding Samurai Card Chess meant for head to head combat.

NI-SHI-KI -Shouden- contains 13 Warlord cards, which are all new and different from the large version (examples; the powerful Tokugawa Ieyasu and Shimazu Yoshihiro).
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon War: Zombie Graveyard
description:
This expansion adds a new card for the board and 5 zombie counters to make it even more challenging for the players to survive and take the Dragon Throne.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon War: Character Enhancement Fate Card Set
description: This 34 Fate Card expansion will enhance one's Dragon War fate deck with all new Fate Cards and a new class of Character Enhancement Fate Cards. These cards will give one's heroes great new powers as they vie for the Dragon Throne.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Jamboree
description:
Up to eight people can play as individuals. Eighteen people can play as partners. Each person (or partnership) is randomly assigned an occupation: manufacturer, planter, jeweler, broker, inventor, doctor, lawyer or publisher. Each player begins the game with a wad of cash. Each player will move one’s own playing piece along the game board’s track. Players move along the gameboard according to a pair special dice, which, together, yield a random number from, zero to six. Along the way, each player must buy all six sections of an assigned possession as a victory condition.

The gameboard is divided into six sections. No player may advance to the next section until all the players have completed the previous section:
Paths of Fortune - Each player moves along a separate path using only one die. Players may pay and collect money from each other. Each player has a guide card, which says what to pay or collect and from whom as one advances along the path.
The Trading Area - Four trains, four planes, four ships and four buses are placed on random Purchase spaces in this area. Here players can buy transportation for use in the next section for price determined by a spinner or barter with other players.
Transportation Department - If a player owns the method of transportation on the space landed there is no penalty. If the player does not own the method of the transportation landed on that player must pay all the players who possess that vehicle. The penalty escalates with the number of vehicles of the designated type owned.
The Jamboree - Whenever two or more players land on the same space, all the players on that space spin the spinner and the player who gets the lowest number pays the penalty the space assigns.
‘Round and ‘Round Circle - If a player has yet to own all six parts on the assigned possession, the player must buy the remaining parts at double the price spun on the spinner. Advancing in this section means paying other players because of their occupation or because one lacks the transportation mode the space asks for. Players continue in this section until rolling doubles.
The Pay Off - Players sell their possessions back to the bank for whatever space on which they land.

When all the players have reached the end of The Pay Off section, each type of vehicle is sold back to the bank for values as determined by the spinner. Bank loans are paid back at 50% interest. The player with the most money wins.

name: "Polly" Farmer's Footy Game
description: This vintage game from Australia is a simulation of Australian football. Two players move a cardboard playing piece that represents a football around an oval shaped arena (ground) that has numbered spaces signifying the players men. The object of the game is to move the football from one number to the next by the roll of a dice, until your team reaches a scoring position on the ground, wins possession of the ball and shoots for goal. highest score at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Fünf in einer Reihe
description:
Hopsi the kangaroo is excited. It's about to go on holidays. The players help Hopsi to pack his bags.
The game consists of 5 quadratic boards each showing items that Hopsi may need for its holiday such as a toothbrush or bathing suit.
Four of the boards belong to the players, the fifth is the one where Hopsi moves around.
The youngest player rolls the dice and moves Hopsi from one up to three spaces. He is allowed to mark the space (item) that he lands on on his map with a red chip.
The first player who achieves marking a row of five spaces (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Cap'n Tock
description: Cap'n Tock is a pirate-themed tock game for children. To win the game, each of the 3 ships (tokens) of a player must go around the board and end up on the treasure island. Movements are decided using the magic wheel you spin on your turn; it shows either one of the 4 colors there are on the squares on the board or the wind symbol. Colors allow you to move a ship to the next square of that color clockwise. If you land on an opponent boat, it cannot move as long as you stay there. The wind symbol allows you to launch a new boat OR move to the next wind square and play again with the same boat OR free your boat from an enemy (going to next wind square) and play again.

name: Special Train
description:
A real 2-player game gem from the early post war days.

Game consists of the game board, 20 tiny, hand painted tin locomotives in a pre-war design, a dice cup and a dice.

Every player has 3 express trains (dark and light red), 3 passenger trains(dark and light green), 3 goods trains (dark and light blue) and a special train (yellow).

Aim of the game is to send all your trains from the starting station to the end station on the opposite side of the board.
Every kind of train has a fixed movement allowance: Expresses 4 squares, passengers 3 sq. and goods 2 sq.
The die only shows how many of your trains you can move, which ones you take is for your own decision.
If you pass on your throw you can move any given train one square back.

The cracker of the game is the name-giving special train lurking in the backyard of your starting station: This can be triggered by your opponent !!!

Once he has done this (or you have done this to him) by throwing a six at any time in the game (your choice), no one stops the special train.
No matter what your throw is, the special train always moves six squares.
So everyone off into the sideways - but these are shared with your opponent, and only one train can occupy a sideway at any time.

Beware: If there is at any time the special train blocked by one of your own trains so it cannot move its 6 squares - you have lost the game...
And if you think you have managed to avoid the yellow monster - it returns a second time !
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: PEKIN 1900
description:
A solitaire card game to recall the siege of the legations in the Beijing in 1900 and the relief forces that they were sent to raise the siege.

The alliance of Great Britain, Russia,Germany, Italy, Japan, Italy,Austro-Hungary and the United States,enemies in few years, against the Chinese Empire

The player tries to arrive with the relief forceses at Peking before 55 days. Meanwhile the Boxers attacks the legations to eliminate the defenders.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Das grosse Hessen-Spiel
description:
A very special game edited during the promotional campaign for the political elections in the German State of Hessen in 1978.

It was a giveaway of the political party of the CDU (Christian Democratic Union) trying to contain some humour against their main opposition, the SPD (Social-Democratic Party of Germany).

The game is a variant of Hoffmanns game JAG UND SCHLAG (Tally Ho).
Thus the rules a rather similar: All the cards are spread out randomly over the board, backside up.
Each player in turn turns a card over, no more altering its position on an ordinary square.
Each card depicts an arrow, in which direction this card can capture a weaker opponent, if possible.
Each card can travel along the lines as far as the player chooses.
Special rules: In the large cities of Hessen (yellow squares with a red border)the direction of the arrow can be altered.
The large cities can also be captured and if occupied at the end of the game count extra points printed on the board, in addition to each captured card during play.

Very good variant with the extra spice of the large city rules which make play very differently to Tally Ho.

Also an extra bonus: All the graphics are from Hoffmann himself !

name: Julemandsspillet
description:
Lots of Christmass fun and exitement!

Who is going to be the Santa of the future. Be the first to solve the X-Mas mission for Sants and you will win the game. But watch out for the fake Santas.

Big game in a roll, ideal for X-Mas and the whole family.

name: Atlantic City
description: You are one of the initial businessmen helping to transform Atlantic City into the first real tourist destination in America. Invest in transportation and real estate (boarding houses and hotels) as you seek to capture more than your fair share of the dollars pouring in from the daytrippers and tourists coming from Philadelphia and New York. Muscle out your opponents, razing their boarding houses to put up your grand hotels. Can you become the real estate magnate of 19th century Atlantic City?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting

name: Supermarina I: The First Part of the Mediterranean War – Scenarios and Statistics for Command at Sea
description:
The First Part of the Mediterranean War - June, 1940 to July, 1941.

Contains Scenarios:

First Blood, Bagnolini vs. Calypso
Action Off Calabria (Punta Stilo)
Cape Spada
Ajax and Convoy MB6
Rainbow's End (Brit SS vs. Italian SS)
The Taranto Raid
Otranto Straits
The Fight off Cape Teulada
The Inshore Squadron at Bardia
Operation Excess
The Vega Incident
Attack on Illustrious
Bombardment of Genoa
Convoy to Tripoli
Disaster in the Gulf of Bomba
Suda Bay
The Sinking of Bonaventure
Kerkennah Bank
The Conte Rosso Convoy
Black Thursday: The Battle for Crete
Night Action in the Kasos Straits
The Lupo Convoy
The Sagittario Convoy

Clash of Arms Stock #9509-53B
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Army Checkers
description:
The object of the game is to capture one or more enemy men between two of your men. Captures may be made along vertical, diagonal or horizontal rows of squares.

On the first turn only, the opening player player places 2 men, 1 on the start in the center of the board and 1 more adjacent. The other player must then place 2 side by side, adjacent to the first player. Each player then places a single man next to an enemy man trying to encase them between friendly men. Any enemy so encased are flipped over to the friendly side.

When maneuvers end the player with the most men showing wins.

name: Carriers: Battle of Midway
description:
The year is 1942 and the Japanese navy is on the offensive. With American naval units heavily depleted after Pearl Harbor and the Battle of Coral Sea, the Imperial Japanese Navy is seeking to strike a decisive blow and consolidate their hold on the Pacific, a prelude to further expansion for the Empire of Japan.

“Battle of Midway” is a turn based game of fleet strategy and close Carrier tactics, pitting the naval fleets of the United States Navy Pacific Fleet and the Imperial Japanese Navy against one another.

Based loosely on the actual events of the 4-7th June 1942 Battle of Midway, players take the role of either;

i) Supreme Commander Pacific Fleet of the US Navy in command of three Carrier Groups & one Battleship Group

or

ii) Combined Fleet Commander of the Imperial Japanese Navy in command of three Carrier Groups & one Battleship Group

The following Carriers & Battleships form the core of the Carrier Groups in this game;

United States Navy Pacific Fleet
1.) USS Enterprise
2.) USS Hornet
3.) USS Yorktown
4.) USS South Dakota

Imperial Japanese Navy
1.) IJN Akagi
2.) IJN Kaga
3.) IJN Hiryu
4.) IJN Yamato

Play is done on individual war charts which only show friendly fleet deployments with ship movements, attack phases and search phases plotted in real time. You have already been informed by Naval intelligence that the enemy fleet is no longer in port. Where is the enemy fleet? How are his ships arrayed? What is their target objective? Should you seek the enemy fleet before he strikes? Should you push ahead with plans to land marines and take the strategic Pacific islands? Or should you take the war to the enemy and attempt to sneak in a lightning strike on his now undefended home ports?

These are questions you need to answer as your battlegroup streams out to engage the enemy. Visibility is only limited to the immediate area around your bases and ships. You will need to send out spotter planes or submarines to screen your fleet as you race to the be first to find and engage the enemy before he finds you. Enemy fleets must be found and destroyed, and the Commander with the best intelligence and planning will prevail!




































You are now in command of one of the most powerful fleets in history.

As Admiral, you will be required to plan and submit a Battle Plan to HQ for the forth-coming battle at Midway. Included in this report, would be your choices for Group Unit Mix, Flag Carrier to bear you into battle, and suitable Battle group deployments for each one of your battle groups. A good commander knows that this initial planning may hold the key to victory and will ensure that a comprehensive strategy and matching Battle group deployments are well set out into a workable plan on paper, well before any ship even begins to leave the harbor.

Having done the initial planning, you are now ready to set sail with your battle groups and put your strategic battle plan into action. Moving your fleets out into the open ocean, you plot the moves of your Fleet Deployments onto your War Chart, watching as events unfold. These first few moves will be crucial in determining the overall battle positions of your fleets as you head towards enemy waters. Do you move your fleets in a broad front, or concentrate them into a narrow wedge, aimed straight for the enemy’s heart? How would the enemy be deployed? What is his plan? These are questions you must ask yourself as Admiral. Decide well, and surprise is on your side. Decide poorly, and risk losing the initiative to a craftier enemy.

With your fleets in position, you now steam steadily towards the enemy. The War Chart now shows the radial tracks from your scouts. But where is the enemy? As the gap between friend and foe narrow, a race develops to see who will be the first to spot the other. Will luck be on your side, or will you fail to send out your scouts in a well-planned search pattern and allow enemy bombers to slip through to your vulnerable Carriers? These are questions only you can answer as you sit and wait for the search reports to trickle in.

Suddenly, the enemy is upon you and your picket ships are hit. As you stare out onto the flight deck from your bridge, what do you do? Do you circle your wagons and search frantically for the enemy, throwing fighter wings into the air in the hope of slugging it out with the enemy bombers which are sure to follow, or try and scatter your ships to disappear back into the vast empty ocean to regroup?

Should you launch bombers from afar, for that long-range strike into the enemy rear, or go in close for a classic surface naval engagement with your Battleship, Cruisers and Destroyers?

Game Objectives

A win is achieved with any one of the following objectives fulfilled;

1.) Destroy all ground defenders and occupy both Midway Atoll and Wake Island with your Marines

2.) Destroy all ground defenders and occupy all three enemy home ports with your Marines

3.) Sink the enemy Flagship (Carrier or Battleship)

The game ends in a draw if no more Troop transports are still afloat from either team or when the loss of too many units on both sides make it impossible to complete the stated objectives.
categories: Fighting, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: No-Joke
description:
"America's Smartest New Game"

NO-JOKE is a truly different game. Pieces include 35 playing pieces (70 for double pack). Pieces are wooden tongue depressors painted black with a row of 3 different shapes on each end. The 5 shapes are hearts, spades, clubs, diamonds and stars.

The object of the game is for players put down the pieces next to each other and to line up as many shapes in a row as possible.

There are 3 versions you can play - straight No-Joke, Progressive Group No-Joke and Solitaire.

name: Bingo Battle
description:
A luck-of-the-dice game for the piecepack friendly and fair to all ages, regardless of skill.

A grid is formed of piecepack tiles. Each player takes turns rolling dice and placing coins on matching tiles in the grid. If three coins are placed on a tile, that stack is 'locked' -- the player who locked it places his pawn on the stack. If, on a future turn, the player rolls the tile again, he 'claims' the stack. However, locked stacks can be 'stolen' by another player who rolls that tile. The player who wins 4 claims first is the winner. Solitaire rules are also included.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Mambo
description:
Mambo is an abstract tile-laying game, conceptually similar to Tantrix and Trax. It is played with a special kind of tiles called mambo tiles.

The goal of the game is to enclose as much are as possible inside shapes of your own color. There are also closely related variants where the goal can be to enclose an opponent's group, or form loops.

The game is named after the abstract patterns that emerge during play, which are reminiscent of the weird tribal artwork of Reg Mombassa.

Official Mambo page: http://www.cameronius.com/games/mambo/

Online Play


Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)

name: Bubble Buster
description:
Simple, playful, active, fun! The first player to burst 20 magic pinging bubbles wins!

BUT BEWARE: Only some of the bubbles have a magic ping - you must burst as many bubbles as you can to find those magic pings. The first player to burst 20 magic pinging bubbles WINS!

Turn on the Bubble Blower, grab your electronic bubble-bursting wand and chase those bubbles! Although you will burst lots of bubbles - only the magic pinging bubbles will make your wand go PING. The PINGS sound higher and higher until you burst the 20th magic pinging bubble and your wand plays the winner's chime.

name: Track Shot: The Demolition Derby Game
description:
Features:
Features more than 500 drivers, each rated in overall performance.
All play derived from 100 "action cards": over 100 cars to choose from.
Track conditions, pre-derby inspections, officiating style all play a part in the outcome.
Fires, the pit crew, hangups, stalls, loose car parts on the track, and many more events/components of a derby are all simulated.
Run heats, a consolation and a main event. 3 different car classes to choose from: Compact, Full-Size ('77 & newer) and Old Iron. Cars take damage just like in a real demo. Keep score as you run the events.

name: Off To War: A jolly nice set of rules for Napoleonic Land Warfare
description:
The book's introduction is as follows: "These rules are primarily for playing a wargame up to Multi-Divisional level in size. However, I have extensively used these rules for Multi-Corps level games with little difficulty.

Please note that not every rule within this document will apply at the same time and in some circumstances you may wish to use certain rules as optional rules. The great thing about wargaming is the choice is yours. It is worth bearing in mind that in most cases, these rules are a compromise between historical fact and playability. Good luck and happy wargaming, for now you are OFF TO WAR.

For use with 6mm, 10mm, 15mm and 20mm scale figures.

name: Fast Mail
description: The game consists of a game board, spinner and six tokens. There are three tokens for each player, representing a Fast Mail train, an Accommodation train , and a Freight train. Certain "rules of the road" apply (e.g. A Freight train must wait on a siding until a Fast Mail passes). The object is to be the first player to move all of your trains from one station to another.

name: Master Europa 105: SouthEastern Front
description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the game "Balkan Front". It contains 47 new counters for use with the logistics system and 1 each for the German and Italian OOB.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Master Europa 106: First Front
description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the game "First to Fight". It contains no counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Master Europa 107: Northern Fronts
description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the games "Narvik" & "Storm over Scandinavia" & "Winter War". It contains 39 new counters for use with the logistics system, and 1 for use with the naval system .
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Sex is Fun
description:
You are about to discover just how much fun you can have playing with your partner. Blowing the hinges off conventional couples games. Sex is Fun goes deeper and gets dirtier, crazier, and kinkier than anything you've ever played before. Find out how well you know each other with 84 of the most carefully engineered questions and challenges specifically designed to peel away inhibitions and shatter boundaries.

Six totally different banks of cards challenge you and your partner to find out just how well you know each other and how far you are willing to go. Take it easy with "Pillow Talk Cards" that help you discover your partner's foreplay preferences or pick it up a notch and draw an "Oral Action Card" to find out the best way to use your lips, tongue, and mouth to please your partner. Draw an "Act It Out Card" and find out how your partner responds to your touch when you follow the secret directions. For fearless couples, we've designed "Kinky Action Cards" that will take your passion in a whole new direction. For competitive couples, we've designed a game option that allows for wagering, bluffing, and daring to beat your partner.

Sex is Fun includes 84 playing cards that will take your sex play to new heights and open the door to conversations and closeness that few relationships achieve. Based on two years of listener feedback garnered from the insanely popular podcast series Sex is Fun, this game is designed specifically to help couples communicate about sex. This game strives to prove that nothing is too taboo to talk about in a loving and caring relationship. This game is proof that, without a doubt, sex is fun. Play with it!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Road to Imladris
description: Home made RPG-adventure cooperative board game based on the hobbits' travel to Rivendell from "The Lord of the Rings". Players move their hobbits across the board to reach Imladris, rolling dice along the way and trying to avoid or fight that which the Dark Lord sends at them. Game ends if the Ringbearer reaches Rivendell and Aragorn is found, and is lost if all hobbits die or time runs out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Waterloo
description:
Similar to classic Risk but set in Europe.

Possibly you believe that dominating Europe is easy, but you will have to play your cards correctly to be able to conquer it.

Your rivals can reconquer your conquered territories at any moment. You will need to have all your effectives available to outlast the constant assaults of your rivals and to have success with your own assault plans.

To conquer Europe is your mission.

Enter to an authentic field of battle.

Components:

- 1 board
- Conquest and objective cards.
- Infantry, Artillery and Cavalry pieces.
- 5 dice
- Instructions

name: Shekels & Sword
description: This is a roll and move game based on being able to recite Bible "Trivia" (biblical facts if you will). It was developed by a renowned scripture educator of the 1970s for Scripture Press Publications. It is intended as a family game for Ages 8 and up.

name: The Russo-Japanese War
description:
Russo-Japanese War is a detailed, operational-level game that models the historical 1904-05 campaign in Manchuria. The game is designed for two players, but can easily accommodate additional players. For example, each side might have separate naval and ground commanders and/or multiple ground commanders. The Russian player controls the Russian ground and naval forces. The Japanese player controls the Japanese ground and naval forces. The Russian player must defend Russian possessions in Manchuria while building up his armies by reinforcement from Siberia and European Russia, and then inflict unacceptable losses on his opponent and force him to sue for peace. The Japanese player must quickly defeat the Russian army before it can reinforce itself. Both sides must avoid heavy losses and a protracted war. Russian National Will and social unrest may bring on the downfall of the monarchy, while Japan has very limited resources (human, military and financial).

Scope:
Units - Division with some Regiments
Scale - 1 hex = 11 miles
Time - 1 Turn = 1 week

Game is packed in a ziplock bag and contains:
* 1,100 double-sided 5/8" counters
* One 22 x 34 Map
* 24 page rules book
* Unit/Terrain Identification Chart
* Ground Game Chart/Terrain Effects Chart
* Naval Game Charts (2)
* Off-Map Movement Charts (3)
* Russian Game Chart
* Japanese Game Chart
* Naval Battle Board
* National Will/Morale Chart
* Master Sequence chart

name: The Secret Game of the Flower Fairies
description:
Based on the illustrations and poems of Cicely Mary Barker, this beautifully crafted game transports players into the enchanted world of Flower Fairies.

The object of the game is to travel around the board from start to finish, passing through each of the four seasons, and arriving at the finish with a complete set of four cards representing the season which each of the four players represents.

Players may only collect cards of their own season. Movement happens based on the roll of a large wooden die, the instructions written on several special squares, or by playing cards out of the players hand. The cards can only be used once.

When the first player reaches home, they count the numbers on the unused cards in their 2-10 pile. The other players are allowed one more turn to get home.

They may try to continue if unsuccessful, but every turn costs them one point from the cards they hold.

The winner is the player who gets home with the most points.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Panzer PaK 5: British Drive to the Rhine
description:
The decisive battles around Arracourt commenced on 15 September 1944 when elements of the German 15th Panzer Grenadier Division clashed with the reconnaissance units of the USA 2nd Cavalry Group. After initially withdrawing, the Germans again advanced near the town of Luneville, with the 111th Panzer Brigade committed as reinforcements.

Caen was the objective of the British 3rd Infantry Division on D-Day due to its position on the Orne River and its roll as a road hub for the area. Many famous units saw action in the conflict including the British 7th Armored Division (the “Desert Rats”) and the German Panzer Lehr and 12th SS Panzer Divisions.

Panzer PaK 5 is an expansion to Panzer Miniatures Rules: A Tactical Game of Armored Combat.

Included Components:


Full-color illustrated booklet



Scenarios: Six historical scenarios focusing on the action near Caen including two on the famous Villers-Bocage battle that may be linked into a mini-campaign



Detailed British and Commonwealth Army TO&E: General organizations from 1944 through 1945 — Armored Divisions, Infantry Division, and Airborne Division to the individual vehicle, gun and squad level



Optional Rules: Limited Hull Down, Hidden movement rules for Panzer



Unit Data Cards: 40 new unit data cards



Hidden Movement Cards: Two hidden movement play cards


Expands:

Panzer Miniatures Rules: A Tactical Game of Armored Combat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Kingdom of Heroes
description:
The king is dying and the kingdom is overrun by chaos. Four of his five daughters are in peril. Soon he shall choose his successor among the nobles called to save the princesses and help rid the kingdom from its enemies. However, the candidate to the throne must also marry one of the princesses.

The players represent those nobles, who wish to prove their value and leadership by sending heroes to complete various missions. They will count on the help of the Royal Wizard Zatorius and Princess Sapphire, who has become a knight of great bravery.

Each turn, the players move a party of heroes and allocate them to missions, represented by cards placed on the board. Heroes of different players may cooperate to complete a mission and share the rewards, but only one takes the card. They should attempt to form sets of different mission types. Most fame points are earned in the end, according to the cards won. The noble who has most fame and the heart of a princess will become the new king.

name: Popeye
description:
From box cover:

Ahoy! It's an exciting 3-dimensional rescue game!

Along with Popeye Card Game this spin-and-move boardgame was published in 1981 to promote the ill-received Robert Altman film.

Complicated setup of the 3-D wharf elements plus simplistic choices (Get a tax card! Spinach for you! No Spinach for you!) based on the color spun (shades of Candy Land) make this a forgettable addition to the growing list of Popeye themed board games.

Ages 7 - 14
2-4 players

By Milton Bradley
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Space 1999
description:
Rules of play from the back of the box:

HOW TO PLAY SPACE 1999 - A game for 2 or more players
Deal all the cards face down to the players. The dealer puts down any card in front of him, and the next player has to put down a card with the same symbol (the symbols are stars, moons, chequers and planets) or the same picture. If he cannot play any card, play passes to the next player. However, if he holds a switch card, he can play that, and he may then switch play to any symbol he chooses. The next player must then play a card with the symbol he has called. The winner is the first player to put down all his cards.

Note: There are separate game pages for the 1976 board game from Milton Bradley and the 1974 board game from Omnia, as well as the Italian game Spazio: 1999.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Spanish Fury, Battle! or Pistolado!
description:
A supplement to the Spanish Fury miniatures gaming rules:

Field Battle rules for the Wars of Religion, 1560-1603. The rules are intended to cover the Wars of Religion in Europe on a regiment scale. The figure scale is 1:40 and ground scale is 1 inch = 25 yards.
categories: Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Spanish Fury, Actions!
description:
From the publisher:

The Spanish Fury system now has modules for Sieges, Field Battles, and Naval Engagements. The Campaign system is just around the corner. One more element was needed to finish the project, and that’s Actions! These rules cover conflicts involving at most 2500 men, at the least about 300. All types of low-level fighting are covered; minor battles, ambushes, raids, prison-breaks, cattle rustling and the storming of forts!

The basic unit of the game is the squadron, which is composed of somewhere between 25-50 men. These are often the size of weak companies, but we use the term company to cover the next administrative level, composed of several squadrons, somewhere between 150-250 men. Each company has a Captain, who has great influence on his men. The overall commander of a side is called a Colonel.

We’ve tried to portray just about every troop type in Europe in these rules, from Irish Kern to Spanish Musketeers. One of our favorite elements of this game is its expandability and "accessable chrome". Anyone can add their favorite forgotten troop type, from Cimaroon to Lap scouts riding Reindeer!
categories: Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Bugs Bunny's Hideout game
description:
Bugs Bunny's Hideout Game. Keep Bugs from his hideout and win!

The object of the game is for Bugs Bunny to race to one of his underground carrot hideouts without being caught. The remaining players play the role of Elmer Fud and try to capture Bugs before get gets to one of 5 hideouts, which is kept secret by Bugs Bunny throughout the game. Players spin the wheel and move to one of four colors or “pick a card” which could loose players there turn or move them ahead or back one or two spaces.

If Bugs Bunny makes it to his hideout he wins. If Elmer Fud catches bugs before getting to his hideout then Elmer Fud wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Indy's Gamble
description:
From the designer's web site: Indy's Gamble is a brand-new card game featuring Indy and his famous movie adventures. There has not been an Indy game like this one before. The idea and design of the game was developed by me (Sascha Krasny) especially for the Indy style of adventures. The game is made for all Indy fans all over the world, especially for the readers of my page :). And now the best part: The game is completely free.

Available for download at:
http://stud4.tuwien.ac.at/~e9125985/IJC/Games/IndysGamble/

name: Silber Dollar
description:
29 cards with symbols from the wild west, dollar coins, dollar bills
2 Games:
(1) Drunter und Drueber. A Cardgame for 3 or 4 Players. It is a trick taking game. The player with the highest card (the silver dollar card) plays against all others. He decides, if the lowest (drunter) or the highest (drueber) card in the trick wins.
(2) Texas-Round-Up. For any Number of Players. The first hand plays a card and gives a limit. The sum of all other players cards should be equal. The last player takes the trick. If the sum is higher than the limit, you lose all your cards.

First edition with silver coins, second edition with yellow coins.

name: Zwick-Zwack
description:
In this game you don't count the fields by the die points, but instead of that the counter with the number of the thrown die is brough tonto th next vacant field.
Each player gets 6 counters of a certain color.
Each player tries to get as many counters as possible on the orange number fields.

When the three red final fields are occupied the game is over.

name: Auto-Scooter
description:
Auto-Scooter at a fair: Each player moves his auto-scooter around the track. He tries to crash into the scooters of the other players and gets "crash points". But has to be careful not caution not to get crashed into from the back.
The winner is the one with the most crash points at the end!

name: Nessy
description:
Content:
board,
100 Nessy parts(head, belly, tail)
1 die,

In the course of the game everyone tries to let develop complete Nessys on the board. A Nessy consists of one head, 1 to 5 bulging out center sections and tail. If a player throws a color and has no more Nessy parts, the game is over. The highest number of completed Nessys determines the winner.

name: Africa Raid
description:
Learn the geography and customs of the people in this African adventure by all-terrain vehicle, crossing the different landscapes of the continent and living the most unexpected dangers.

It exalts the competitive spirit and capacity of planning to raise every race.

name: Voidstriker Ship Recognition Guide #1
description:
Ship descriptions and record sheets, plus campaign rules for Voidstriker.

The Voidstriker Ship Recognition Guide #1 details 16 ships from the Terran Defense Force, the Martian Republican Guard, and the Jovian Alliance Navy. In addition, record sheets are included for all the sample ships in the Voidstriker rulebook, and a simple set of campaign rules allows you to take your place among the stars. By force, if necessary...

Expands:

Voidstriker
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Street Fighting in Berlin
description:
This game covers the Battle for Berlin, and is designed by the same game designer of The Battle for Iwo Jima. The game includes one A2-sized map of Berlin, divided into areas in a manner similar to Storm over Arnhem, as well as one A3-sized reproduction of the map. This is similar in nature to the one featured at the back of the rulebook in Storm over Arnhem, and presumably to be used for the same purpose. The game also includes 81 counters.

This game was designed by Works-Zero (www.works-zero.com).

name: The Road to Berlin: The Last Act in the East
description:
Work continues on this long-awaited design by Joseph Youst. The current development team is moving to polish this operational simulation of the most intense four months of combat in the history of War.

German Army Groups keep supplies and the Luftwaffe's air power moving to support their subordinate armies holding the threatened bulwark in the East. Soviet Fronts keep supplies and the Red Falcons flooding west with the armies heading toward the target of Stalin's vengeance: BERLIN.

THE ROAD TO BERLIN: The Last Act in the East contains:

three Joseph Youst maps - one 22 x 34 inches, one 22 x 42 inches, one 34 x 44 inches - covering Europe from Courland to Hungary, and from the Western border of the Soviet Union to central Germany

1500+ 1/2 inch die-cut back printed counters showing the military forces that took part - Axis divisions plus separate brigades, regiments, and companies - and Soviet corps and their supporting divisions, brigades and regiment forces

VISTULA '45: Germany's Last Offensive - This introductory scenario combines all of the combat interactions in this system in the struggle for the town of Stargard, where the German Army expended its utmost efforts to hold back the enemy. Historically, this fight caused considerable concern in the Kremlin and allowed thousands of civilians to escape to the west. [Note: VISTULA '45: will also be available separately in Folio format.]

Included: charts, rules, dice, boxed (box was ordered in 1994!)

name: Word Storm
description: Players simultaneously draw and play random letter tiles vertically and horizontally to build a crossword. When a player creates one or more words with all the tiles, they call out Word Storm. All players then grab 4 more tiles and continue playing until the tiles run out and one player uses up all of his or her letter tiles. Players score points based on their words and are penalized for the letters they don’t use.
categories: Educational, Math, Party Game, Word Game

name: Oktawars
description:
Oktawars is the official prequel of Oktagrid.
In the box you'll find over 60 pawns, towers, sheets, dices, special tokens and a wooden modular board, a quick reference sheet and, obviously, the game rules.

Let's see the story of the game...

Once upon a time, there were eight Mages.
